original: gyos pos bsam pa /
analyzed: gyos pos bsam pa /

translated: The six elder daughters-in-law said, We cannot do it.

translated: The youngest daughter-in-law did as she had said. In the morning she got up first and swept the house and sprinkled it with water. Then she prepared the food and served it first to her parents-in-law and then to the others in order of age.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu bran khol dang / las byed rnams la zan byin nas so sor las la bcud de gzod bdag zan za'o //
translated: After that she served the food to the servants and slaves and assigned them to their work. Only then did she eat herself.

analyzed: rtag tu de 'dra bar byed pas gyos pos kyang bdag gi mna' ma 'di ni /
translated: Because she always acted in this way, her father-in-law said, My daughter-in-law is not like the others.

analyzed: gzhan dang mi 'dra ste tha mal pa ni /🔽ma yin na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir bu mo bdag gi mas bsgo ba ltar mi byed snyam bsams nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Why do you not do as my mother commands?”

analyzed: khyod khyim nas chas pa'i tshe khyod kyi mas rtag tu gos bzang po gyon la kha zas zhim po zo zhig /

analyzed: rtag tu me long la ltos shig ces bya ba ci'i tha tshig ces dris na /

original: mna' mas bus mos la btsugs te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mna' mas bus mos la btsugs te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The daughter-in-law knelt on the ground and said,

analyzed: bdag gi mas gos bzang po gyon cig ces bsgo ba ni / steng du gyon ba'i @335a *//
translated: “When my mother said, ‘Wear fine clothes,’🔽she meant that you should always take care of the clothes you wear on top,

analyzed: bzhag gos lta bu la rtag tu bag bya zhing ma rnying par gyis shig /
translated: and not let them get old and shabby.

analyzed: mgron nam phyi mi dag 'ongs na gos ma ngan zhig ces mchi'o //
translated: When guests or strangers come, you should not wear shabby clothes.”

original: rtag tu kha zas zhim po zo zhig pa ni /
analyzed: rtag tu kha zas zhim po zo zhig pa ni /
translated: “When she said, ‘Always eat good food,’

analyzed: kha zas zhim po dang / bsod pa la bgyi ba ma lags kyi /
translated: she did not mean that you should eat only good food and delicacies.

original: su bas kyang phyis zos na bkres pas kha zas kun tu zhim mo //
analyzed: su bas kyang phyis zos na bkres pas kha zas kun tu zhim mo //
translated: If you eat later than others, you will find the food very good because of your hunger.”

original: zhes mchi'o // rtag tu me long la ltos shig ces bsgo ba ni /
analyzed: zhes mchi'o // rtag tu me long la ltos shig ces bsgo ba ni /
translated: So she said to me, Always look into the mirror.

original: 'khar ba'am / lcags kyi me long la lta ba ma lags kyi /
analyzed: 'khar ba'am / lcags kyi me long la lta ba ma lags kyi /
translated: It is not a bronze or iron mirror that I look into,

original: sngar longs la phyi nang gi phyag dar bya ba dang / chag chag gdab pa dang / khri stan gding ba la sogs pa las su bya ba rnams legs par gyis shig ces mchi ste /
analyzed: sngar longs la phyi nang gi phyag dar bya ba dang / chag chag gdab pa dang / khri stan gding ba la sogs pa las su bya ba rnams legs par gyis shig ces mchi ste /
translated: but I am told to look into the mirror of my own mind, and to do the work of sweeping out the house, inside and out, of sprinkling and sweeping it, of laying out seats and so on.

original: bdag gi mas bsgo ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gi mas bsgo ba ni /
translated: My mother said to me,

original: 'di lta bu lags so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu lags so //
translated: and this is what I said to her.

analyzed: zhes gsol pa dang / mna' ma de la lhag par byams te khyim gyi las thams cad gtad nas thams cad bde zhing skyid par gyur to //

analyzed: khye'u de zam pa'i steng du phyin pa dang / blon po chen po'i bu zhig kyang shing rta'i nang na 'dug ste phyi rol nas nang du 'ong ba dang zam pa'i steng du @338a *//
translated: When the boy reached the bridge, a son of a great minister was in a carriage coming from the outside and entering. They met on the bridge.

original: phrad pa las gnyi ga tsho rigs kyis bsnyems nas gcig gis gcig la ma byol lo //
analyzed: phrad pa las gnyi ga tsho rigs kyis bsnyems nas gcig gis gcig la ma byol lo //
translated: Both were arrogant because of their families and would not yield to the other.

original: lha mtshams ma'i bu khros nas glang po che la zhon bzhin du blo na po chen po'i bu shing rta dang bcas pa zam pa'i 'og tu bor ro //
analyzed: lha mtshams ma'i bu khros nas glang po che la zhon bzhin du blo na po chen po'i bu shing rta dang bcas pa zam pa'i 'og tu bor ro //
translated: The son of the brāhmaṇa became angry. While riding on the elephant, he threw the son of the great minister and his carriage under the bridge.

original: blon po'i bu de lus dang rkang lag snad nas dus te phyir khyim du 'ongs nas pha ma la 'di skad du lha mtshams ma'i bus bdag ma nongs par 'di ltar gnod pa bgyis nas lus kun snad do //🔽zhes gsol to //
analyzed: blon po'i bu de lus dang rkang lag snad nas dus te phyir khyim du 'ongs nas pha ma la 'di skad du lha mtshams ma'i bus bdag ma nongs par 'di ltar gnod pa bgyis nas lus kun snad do // zhes gsol to //
translated: The minister’s son was injured all over his body and limbs. He returned home and said to his parents, “The son of Tiṣya has harmed me without my having offended him. He has injured me all over my body.”

original: blon po chen po de shin tu mi dga' bar gyur nas bu /
analyzed: blon po chen po de shin tu mi dga' bar gyur nas bu /
translated: The great minister was very unhappy. He said to his son,

original: de dag ni /🔽shin tu yang stobs che ba'i steng du rgyal po dang nye bas rtsod par dka' na /
analyzed: de dag ni / shin tu yang stobs che ba'i steng du rgyal po dang nye bas rtsod par dka' na /
translated: “Those people

original: 'on kyang de la ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la ni /
translated: are very powerful, and because they are close to the king, it is difficult to dispute with them.🔽However, I will steal back your property

original: rku lto zhig bya'o snyam nas rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i 'khar ba sum cu rtsa gnyis shig byas te; 'khar pa'i nang du ral gri so rnon po re re bcug nas khye'u sum cu rtsa gnyis po de la re re byin nas 'di skad ces
analyzed: rku lto zhig bya'o snyam nas rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i 'khar ba sum cu rtsa gnyis shig byas te; 'khar pa'i nang du ral gri so rnon po re re bcug nas khye'u sum cu rtsa gnyis po de la re re byin nas 'di skad ces
translated: for you.” He made thirty-two staffs out of the seven precious substances, and inside each staff he inserted a sharp sword. He gave one to each of the thirty-two young men and said,

original: bsgo'o // khyed ni /
analyzed: bsgo'o // khyed ni /
translated: “You must do this.

original: gzhon zhing dar la bab pas rtse ba'i dus la bab ste; khyed kyi phyir rtse ba'i rkyen du 'khar ba 'di dag byas kyi /
analyzed: gzhon zhing dar la bab pas rtse ba'i dus la bab ste; khyed kyi phyir rtse ba'i rkyen du 'khar ba 'di dag byas kyi /
translated: “You are young and in the prime of life, and the time has come for you to play. I have had these sticks made for you to play with.

original: khyed rnams thogs la rtses shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: khyed rnams thogs la rtses shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Take them and play with them.”

original: khye'u de dag kyang shin tu dga' nas 'khar ba de dag blangs nas re re thogs so //
analyzed: khye'u de dag kyang shin tu dga' nas 'khar ba de dag blangs nas re re thogs so //
translated: The young men were delighted. They took the sticks and each held one.

original: rgyal po'i khrims kyis rgyal po dang phrad pa na mtshon thogs su mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khrims kyis rgyal po dang phrad pa na mtshon thogs su mi gnang ngo //
translated: By royal law, when one meets the king, one is not allowed to carry weapons.

original: de dag 'khar ba thogs te rgyal po'i zham 'bring nas 'khod pa las /
analyzed: de dag 'khar ba thogs te rgyal po'i zham 'bring nas 'khod pa las /
translated: So they stood in attendance on the king, holding their sticks.

original: blon po des @338b rgyal po la 'di skad du phra ma gsol to //
analyzed: blon po des @338b rgyal po la 'di skad du phra ma gsol to //
translated: The minister slandered them to the king, saying,

original: lha mtshams ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis po de ni /
analyzed: lha mtshams ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis po de ni /
translated: “Your Majesty, the thirty-two sons of Viśālanetra

original: gzhon zhing dar la bab ste /
analyzed: gzhon zhing dar la bab ste /
translated: are young and in the prime of life.

original: stobs kyis mi gcig gis kyang stong thub pa de dag ni /
analyzed: stobs kyis mi gcig gis kyang stong thub pa de dag ni /
translated: Each of them is strong enough to defeat a thousand men.

original: rgyal po la gnod pa zhig bgyi bar sems so //
analyzed: rgyal po la gnod pa zhig bgyi bar sems so //
translated: They are plotting to harm the king.”

original: zhes gsol to //
analyzed: zhes gsol to //
translated: He said this,

original: 'on kyang rgyal po de dag la thugs ma ches pa med pa las /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyal po de dag la thugs ma ches pa med pa las /
translated: but the king did not believe him.

original: blon pos yang gsol pa /
analyzed: blon pos yang gsol pa /
translated: The minister said,

original: bdag gis sngar gsol pa 'di bden te /
analyzed: bdag gis sngar gsol pa 'di bden te /
translated: What I said before is true.

original: rdzun ma lags pas rtag tu gda'o //
analyzed: rdzun ma lags pas rtag tu gda'o //
translated: It is not a lie.

original: khye'u 'di dag gi lag na thogs pa'i 'khar ba'i nang na ral gri re re mchis pas gnod pa bgyid du mngon no //
analyzed: khye'u 'di dag gi lag na thogs pa'i 'khar ba'i nang na ral gri re re mchis pas gnod pa bgyid du mngon no //
translated: In the staffs that these boys are carrying there are swords. They will do harm.

original: blon pos gsol pa bzhin du khye'u de dag gi mkhar ba bltas na /
analyzed: blon pos gsol pa bzhin du khye'u de dag gi mkhar ba bltas na /
translated: As the minister had said, when the staffs were examined,

original: mtshon yod par gyur nas gcig nas kyang gcig pos te gyad kyis bzung nas kun bsad do //
analyzed: mtshon yod par gyur nas gcig nas kyang gcig pos te gyad kyis bzung nas kun bsad do //
translated: swords were found in them. The strong men seized them and killed all the boys.

original: khye'u de dag gi mgo bcad de khye'u'i mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis sgrom gcig gi nang du bcug nas kha legs par bcad de sring mo'i steng du bskur ro //
analyzed: khye'u de dag gi mgo bcad de khye'u'i mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis sgrom gcig gi nang du bcug nas kha legs par bcad de sring mo'i steng du bskur ro //
translated: The heads of the boys were cut off. The heads of thirty-two boys were put in a box, the top was nailed down, and it was sent to the sister.

original: de'i tshe na khye'u de dag gi mas sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun spyan drangs te rgyal pos sgro ma bskur te 'ongs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khye'u de dag gi mas sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun spyan drangs te rgyal pos sgro ma bskur te 'ongs pa la /
translated: At that time the mother of the boys invited the Buddha and the Sangha. The king sent the box.

original: 'di'i nang na mchod pa byed pa'i mthud ma zhig yod yang dag snyam nas sgrom kha phye ba las /
analyzed: 'di'i nang na mchod pa byed pa'i mthud ma zhig yod yang dag snyam nas sgrom kha phye ba las /
translated: I think there is a connection between this and the offering of food. He opened the box.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrom re zhig kha ma phye bar zhal zas gsol lags nas gzod phye zhig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrom re zhig kha ma phye bar zhal zas gsol lags nas gzod phye zhig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said, Do not open the box yet. Eat the food first, then open it.

original: de nas zhal zas gsol nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u'i ma la chos bstan pa /
analyzed: de nas zhal zas gsol nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u'i ma la chos bstan pa /
translated: Then, after eating the food, the Blessed One taught the Dharma to the boy's mother.

original: lus 'di ni /
analyzed: lus 'di ni /
translated: This body is

original: mi @339a *// rtag pa ste /
analyzed: mi @339a *// rtag pa ste /
translated: impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal pa /
translated: suffering,🔽empty,

original: stong pa / bdag med pa /
analyzed: stong pa / bdag med pa /
translated: without self,

original: snying po med pa /
analyzed: snying po med pa /
translated: and without essence.

original: ring po mi thogs pa /
analyzed: ring po mi thogs pa /
translated: It will not last long.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas cings shing glags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas cings shing glags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir pa ste /
translated: It is bound and obstructed by afflictions, and oppressed by suffering.

original: 'dod pa dang bye bral ba'i mya ngan gyis lus 'di chud zos kyang phan pa med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bye bral ba'i mya ngan gyis lus 'di chud zos kyang phan pa med de /
translated: Even though this body is wasted away by the sorrow of separation from what is desired, it is of no benefit.

original: gang mkhas pa shes rab can gyis ni /
analyzed: gang mkhas pa shes rab can gyis ni /
translated: But for the wise and the learned,

original: don 'di rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don 'di rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: this meaning will be realized.

original: zhes bka' stsal pa dang / lha mtshams mas kyang don rtogs nas lan gcig phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa dang / lha mtshams mas kyang don rtogs nas lan gcig phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur te /
translated: The nun, understanding the meaning of the Buddha's words, attained the fruit of once-returner.

original: rab tu dga' dgu rangs nas thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag cag gis gsol pa 'di bzhi zhig gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: rab tu dga' dgu rangs nas thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das bdag la thugs brtse ba'i slad du bdag cag gis gsol pa 'di bzhi zhig gnang bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: She was filled with joy and, with palms placed together, she said to the Blessed One,

original: bdag cag gis gsol pa bzhi la /
analyzed: bdag cag gis gsol pa bzhi la /
translated: Blessed One, out of compassion for me, please grant me these four requests.

original: gcig ni / dge slong nad pa rnams la nad kyi rkyen sman dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba yid bzhin du stsal pa dang / gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gcig ni / dge slong nad pa rnams la nad kyi rkyen sman dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba yid bzhin du stsal pa dang / gnyis pa ni /
translated: The four requests are: First, to provide medicine, food, and drink according to the wishes of sick monks; second,

original: dge slong nad pa'i g-yog bgyi ba'i bza' ba dang / btung ba yid bzhin du sbyar ba dang / gsum pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa'i g-yog bgyi ba'i bza' ba dang / btung ba yid bzhin du sbyar ba dang / gsum pa ni /
translated: to provide food and drink according to the wishes of those who care for sick monks; third,

original: dge slong mgron po'i yi byad sbyar ba dang / bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong mgron po'i yi byad sbyar ba dang / bzhi pa ni /
translated: to provide provisions for traveling monks; and fourth,

original: dge slong mgron du 'gro ba'i rgyags dang / yo byad sbyar bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge slong mgron du 'gro ba'i rgyags dang / yo byad sbyar bar 'tshal lo //
translated: to provide provisions and necessities for monks who are traveling.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge slong nad pa dag ni /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa dag ni /
translated: Monks who are sick

original: nad kyi rkyen sman dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba mi ldan na /
analyzed: nad kyi rkyen sman dang / bza' ba dang / btung ba mi ldan na /
translated: if they do not have the conditions for medicine, food, and drink,

original: nad 'tsho @339b dka' ste /
analyzed: nad 'tsho @339b dka' ste /
translated: it will be difficult for them to recover from their illness.

original: gal te na tshe'i bar chad du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te na tshe'i bar chad du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not recover, it will be an obstacle to their lives.

original: dge slong nad g-yog kyang kha zas med pa'i rkyen gyis bsod snyoms bgyid do //
analyzed: dge slong nad g-yog kyang kha zas med pa'i rkyen gyis bsod snyoms bgyid do //
translated: Monks who are nursing the sick will also perform alms-rounds due to the condition of not having food.

original: bsod snyoms la dus ma mchis te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la dus ma mchis te /
translated: There is no time for alms-rounds.

original: gal te 'phyis sam /
analyzed: gal te 'phyis sam /
translated: If they are late,

original: 'dod pa ma rnyed na /
analyzed: 'dod pa ma rnyed na /
translated: or if they do not get what they want,

original: nad pa zhe sdang skyes te nad 'tsho bar dka' bas /
analyzed: nad pa zhe sdang skyes te nad 'tsho bar dka' bas /
translated: the sick person will give rise to anger, and it will be difficult for them to recover.

original: de la yang kha zas dbul bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de la yang kha zas dbul bar 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, I request that you offer them food.

original: shul ring po nas mchis pa'i dge slong yul ma 'dris te bshes ma mchis pas bsod snyoms bgyid do //
analyzed: shul ring po nas mchis pa'i dge slong yul ma 'dris te bshes ma mchis pas bsod snyoms bgyid do //
translated: Monks who have come from far away, who are unfamiliar with the country and have no friends, will perform alms-rounds.

original: bsod snyoms bgyid pa na khyi'am ma rungs pas gtses te zhe sdang skyes na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms bgyid pa na khyi'am ma rungs pas gtses te zhe sdang skyes na /
translated: While performing alms-rounds, they may be harmed by dogs or wild animals, and if they give rise to anger,

original: bzod pa nyams par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bzod pa nyams par 'gyur bas /
translated: their patience will be impaired.

original: de la yang kha zas dbul bar 'tshal lo /
analyzed: de la yang kha zas dbul bar 'tshal lo /
translated: Therefore, I request that you offer them food.

original: dge slong mgron du mchi ba grogs dang ldan pa yang lam rgyags ma mchis pas grogs dang bral ban /
analyzed: dge slong mgron du mchi ba grogs dang ldan pa yang lam rgyags ma mchis pas grogs dang bral ban /
translated: The monk who is going on a journey, even if he has a companion, will be separated from him because he has no provisions.

original: shul du gcan gzan mang po'am /
analyzed: shul du gcan gzan mang po'am /
translated: In the wilderness there are many wild beasts,🔽or there are ferocious savages.

original: mi rgod ma rungs pa mchis te; gcig pu song na de yang lus kyi bar chad du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: mi rgod ma rungs pa mchis te; gcig pu song na de yang lus kyi bar chad du 'gyur bas /
translated: If he goes alone, that will be an obstacle to his body.

original: des dgos pa yang sbyar par 'tshal lo //🔽de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lha mtshams mas gsol ba bzhi po gsan nas shin tu legs so //
analyzed: des dgos pa yang sbyar par 'tshal lo // de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lha mtshams mas gsol ba bzhi po gsan nas shin tu legs so //
translated: Therefore, he should also prepare what is necessary.

original: zhes bsngags te /
analyzed: zhes bsngags te /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, having heard the four requests of Devaprajña, praised him, saying, Excellent!

original: khyod kyis gsol ba bzhi po 'di'i bsod nams rgya chen po ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis gsol ba bzhi po 'di'i bsod nams rgya chen po ni /
translated: The great merit of these four requests of yours

original: sangs rgyas la mchod pa byas pa dang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mchod pa byas pa dang tha mi dad do //
translated: is no different from making offerings to the Buddha.

original: zhes bka' stsal nas dge 'dun dang bcas te slar rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du gshegs so //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal nas dge 'dun dang bcas te slar rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal du gshegs so //
translated: Having spoken thus, he returned to the Jeta Grove together with the Sangha.

original: bcom ldan 'das slar gshegs pa'i 'og tu sgrom phye ba bltas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das slar gshegs pa'i 'og tu sgrom phye ba bltas na /
translated: After the Blessed One had left, when they opened the chest and looked,

original: bu'i mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis yod pa @340a *//
analyzed: bu'i mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis yod pa @340a *//
translated: they saw that the boy had thirty-two heads.

original: mthong nas 'dod pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi dga' bas gdungs par ni /
analyzed: mthong nas 'dod pa dang bral ba'i phyir mi dga' bas gdungs par ni /
translated: Having seen this, one is disgusted and is tormented by aversion.

original: ma gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma gyur gyi /
translated: Having seen this, he was not distressed by the thought of separation from his son.

original: 'di skad du kye ma mi gcig skyes pa la tshe zad pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du kye ma mi gcig skyes pa la tshe zad pa yod de /
translated: He said, “Alas! When a man is born, his life is exhausted.

original: de ring por ma thogs so //
analyzed: de ring por ma thogs so //
translated: This is not a matter of long delay.

original: da yang rgyud lnga gang na sdug bsngal myong bar gyur ces smras so //
analyzed: da yang rgyud lnga gang na sdug bsngal myong bar gyur ces smras so //
translated: Now, in which of the five destinies will he experience suffering?”

original: khye'u sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ma'i rigs su nye ba rnams de ltar gyur pa thos nas shin tu mi dga' ste zhe sdang skyes nas 'di skad du rgyal po chen po ni /
analyzed: khye'u sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ma'i rigs su nye ba rnams de ltar gyur pa thos nas shin tu mi dga' ste zhe sdang skyes nas 'di skad du rgyal po chen po ni /
translated: The relatives of the thirty-two children, having heard of this, were very unhappy. They gave rise to anger and said, “The great king

original: 'di ltar mi mnyes pa kun bsad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi mnyes pa kun bsad kyi /
translated: has killed all those who are not pleasing to him.

original: dmag bsags la dgra bya bar 'dong ngo //
analyzed: dmag bsags la dgra bya bar 'dong ngo //
translated: We will gather an army and go to make war on him.”

original: zhes smras nas dmag gi dpung bsags te rgyal po'i pho brang bskor to //
analyzed: zhes smras nas dmag gi dpung bsags te rgyal po'i pho brang bskor to //
translated: Having said this, they gathered an army and surrounded the king’s palace.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po de sgrag nas sangs rgyas gang na ba der bros so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po de sgrag nas sangs rgyas gang na ba der bros so //
translated: At that time, the king heard about this and fled to where the Buddha was.

original: de dag gis de skad ces thos nas dmag gi dpung gis rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal yang bskor to; ;de'i tshe kun dga' bos rgyal po rab gsal rgyal gyis lha mtshams ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis bsad de ma'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams kyis sha gnyer🔽du 'ongs so //
analyzed: de dag gis de skad ces thos nas dmag gi dpung gis rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal yang bskor to; ;de'i tshe kun dga' bos rgyal po rab gsal rgyal gyis lha mtshams ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis bsad de ma'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams kyis sha gnyer du 'ongs so //
translated: At that time, Ānanda heard that King Prasenajit had killed thirty-two of the sons of Devadatta, and that the remaining relatives of his mother had come to take revenge.

original: zhes thos nas pus mo sa la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: zhes thos nas pus mo sa la btsugs te thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He knelt on the ground, put his palms together, and said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis mi sum cu rtsa gnyis rgyal pos gcig car du bkum par gyur /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis mi sum cu rtsa gnyis rgyal pos gcig car du bkum par gyur /
translated: what are the causes and conditions for the king to have killed thirty-two people at once?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Ānanda,

original: lha mtshams ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dang 'ba' zhig tu rgyal pos gcig car du bsad @340b par ma zad do //
analyzed: lha mtshams ma'i bu sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dang 'ba' zhig tu rgyal pos gcig car du bsad @340b par ma zad do //
translated: It is not only now that the king has killed thirty-two people at once.

original: mi sum cu rtsa gnyis po ci'i phyir gcig car tshe 'phos pa khyod la rgyas par bstan gyi /
analyzed: mi sum cu rtsa gnyis po ci'i phyir gcig car tshe 'phos pa khyod la rgyas par bstan gyi /
translated: I will explain in detail to you why thirty-two people died at once.

original: legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig ces bka' stsal nas kun dga' bos kyang de bzhin du bgyi'o //
analyzed: legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig ces bka' stsal nas kun dga' bos kyang de bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind!

original: thos par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thos par 'tshal lo //
translated: Yes, Ananda replied, I will listen to the Buddha's teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to Ananda:🔽In the past, these thirty-two people were close friends.

original: sngon 'das pa'i dus na mi sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di gcig pa gcig dga' zhing bshes pa dang // yid gcugs par gyur nas de dag gros mthun par pha rol gzhan gyi ba lang zhig brkus so //
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i dus na mi sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di gcig pa gcig dga' zhing bshes pa dang // yid gcugs par gyur nas de dag gros mthun par pha rol gzhan gyi ba lang zhig brkus so //

He beat her.

analyzed: bdag gis bu btsas so;/

analyzed: zhes byas na /

original: shu do la gar ne'i le'u /
analyzed: shu do la gar ne'i le'u /
translated: The Chapter on Śuddhodana

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya ka lanta ka gnas pa 'od ma'i tshal na bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya ka lanta ka gnas pa 'od ma'i tshal na bzhugs so //
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time, the Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandaka Nivāpa, the Bamboo Grove.

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo 'dug pa las langs nas gos tshags bcos @352a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo 'dug pa las langs nas gos tshags bcos @352a *//
translated: At that time, the Venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, adjusted his robes,

original: te pus mo sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: te pus mo sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: placed his right knee on the ground, joined his palms, and said to the Blessed One:

original: koondi n+ya la sogs pa dge slong lnga po 'di ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ma thag tu chos kyi bdud rtsi sngar myong ba bstan du gsol /
analyzed: koondi n+ya la sogs pa dge slong lnga po 'di ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ma thag tu chos kyi bdud rtsi sngar myong ba bstan du gsol /
translated: Why was it that the five bhikṣus, Kauṇḍinya and the others, were the first to taste the nectar of the Dharma when the Bhagavat had just turned the wheel of the Dharma in the world?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said to Ānanda,

original: dge slong lnga po 'di dag sngon yang nga'i sha sngar zos te bde bar gyur pas 'dir yang chos kyi ro thog mar myong ste rnam par grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong lnga po 'di dag sngon yang nga'i sha sngar zos te bde bar gyur pas 'dir yang chos kyi ro thog mar myong ste rnam par grol bar gyur to //
translated: “These five bhikṣus have already eaten my flesh in the past and have been happy. Now they have tasted the flavor of the Dharma first and have been liberated.”

original: kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Ānanda said to the Bhagavat,

original: dge slong 'di lngas sngon ci bgyis pa bstan du gsol /
analyzed: dge slong 'di lngas sngon ci bgyis pa bstan du gsol /
translated: “Please explain what these five bhikṣus did in the past.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said to Ānanda,

original: sngon 'das pa'i bskal pa tshad med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'das pa'i snga rol du 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir rgyal po shu do la gar ne zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i bskal pa tshad med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'das pa'i snga rol du 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir rgyal po shu do la gar ne zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: “In the past, incalculable, limitless, inconceivable, immeasurable, and indescribable numbers of eons ago, there was a king in this world named Śuddhodana.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed la dbang byed do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed la dbang byed do //
translated: He ruled over eighty-four thousand minor kingdoms of Jambudvīpa.

original: de'i tshe na yul der lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du char mi 'bab bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul der lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du char mi 'bab bo //
translated: At that time, an astrologer predicted that for twelve years there would be no rain.

original: zhes ltas mkhan gyis lung bstan nas rgyal pos de skad ces thos pa dang / rab tu mya ngan gyis yi mug par gyur te /
analyzed: zhes ltas mkhan gyis lung bstan nas rgyal pos de skad ces thos pa dang / rab tu mya ngan gyis yi mug par gyur te /
translated: When the king heard this, he was very sad and distressed.

original: 'di ltar mu ge chen po byung na mi mang po 'di dag la lo de snyed kyi kha zas ji ltar rnyed snyam nas rgyal phran dang blon po kun @352b bsdus te bgros na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mu ge chen po byung na mi mang po 'di dag la lo de snyed kyi kha zas ji ltar rnyed snyam nas rgyal phran dang blon po kun @352b bsdus te bgros na /
translated: He thought, “If such a great famine occurs, how can I find food for these many people for that many years?” He gathered all the minor kings and ministers and discussed this.

original: bang ba na 'bru ji snyed yod pa dang / da ltar mi ji snyed yod pa rtsis su sbyar na /
analyzed: bang ba na 'bru ji snyed yod pa dang / da ltar mi ji snyed yod pa rtsis su sbyar na /
translated: They calculated the amount of grain in the granaries and the number of people who were currently there.

original: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du mi re la phul re'i thad du brtsis na yang lo bcu gnyis su mi thub bo //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du mi re la phul re'i thad du brtsis na yang lo bcu gnyis su mi thub bo //
translated: They calculated how much grain there was per person for twelve years, but it would not last twelve years.

original: zhes dril bsgrags so //
analyzed: zhes dril bsgrags so //
translated: They made an announcement.

original: de nas phyi phyir yang mu ge che bar gyur te tshe 'phos pa yang mang nas rgyal po des ji ltar byas na mi mang po 'tsho bar 'gyur snyam bsams te btsun mo dang pho brang slas su bcas te skyed mos tshal du 'chag tu song ba las
analyzed: de nas phyi phyir yang mu ge che bar gyur te tshe 'phos pa yang mang nas rgyal po des ji ltar byas na mi mang po 'tsho bar 'gyur snyam bsams te btsun mo dang pho brang slas su bcas te skyed mos tshal du 'chag tu song ba las
translated: Then, later on, there was a great famine, and many people died. The king thought, “What can I do to save the many people?” He went to the park to walk about with his queen and the palace women.

original: bsti ba'i gnas shig tu phyin nas btsun mo dang / mi mang po kun gnyid kyis log pa'i 'og tu nyal ba las langs nas phyogs bzhir phyag 'tshal te 'di lta bu'i yi dam bcas so //
analyzed: bsti ba'i gnas shig tu phyin nas btsun mo dang / mi mang po kun gnyid kyis log pa'i 'og tu nyal ba las langs nas phyogs bzhir phyag 'tshal te 'di lta bu'i yi dam bcas so //
translated: He went to a place of worship and, after the queen and the many people had all gone to sleep, he got up and prostrated in the four directions. He made this kind of vow:

original: yul 'dir mu ge byung bas thams cad bza' ba med par gyur te ltogs kyi /
analyzed: yul 'dir mu ge byung bas thams cad bza' ba med par gyur te ltogs kyi /
translated: “In this country there is a famine, and everyone is starving because there is no food.

original: bdag gi lus 'di btang ste tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu nya chen po zhig tu skyes nas thams cad bdag gi sha la za zhing kun 'grangs par shog cig ces smon lam btab nas shing zhig la 'dzegs te shing kha nas lus g-yang du btang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di btang ste tshe 'phos pa'i 'og tu nya chen po zhig tu skyes nas thams cad bdag gi sha la za zhing kun 'grangs par shog cig ces smon lam btab nas shing zhig la 'dzegs te shing kha nas lus g-yang du btang ngo //
translated: After I give up my body and die, may I be reborn as a great fish. May everyone eat my flesh and be satisfied.” He made this aspiration and climbed a tree. He threw himself off the tree.

original: der tshe 'phos nas chu chen por brdzus te skyes ba'i nya chen po dpag tshad lnga brgya pa zhig tu gyur to //
analyzed: der tshe 'phos nas chu chen por brdzus te skyes ba'i nya chen po dpag tshad lnga brgya pa zhig tu gyur to //
translated: After death he was reborn in the great river, miraculously born as a huge fish five hundred leagues long.

original: de'i tshe yul de na shing mkhan mi lnga zhig chu 'gram du shing 'byor dong pa las /
analyzed: de'i tshe yul de na shing mkhan mi lnga zhig chu 'gram du shing 'byor dong pa las /
translated: At that time, five wood-gatherers from the country were on the river bank collecting wood.

original: nya chen po de mthong nas nya des mi'i skad du 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: nya chen po de mthong nas nya des mi'i skad du 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When they saw the huge fish, the fish spoke to them in human language, saying:

original: khyed bkres na nga'i sha la bcad de ci 'dod pa zo zhig /
analyzed: khyed bkres na nga'i sha la bcad de ci 'dod pa zo zhig /
translated: “If you are hungry, cut up my flesh and eat as much as you want.

original: 'grangs nas kyang ci theg pa khyim du khyer @353a *//
analyzed: 'grangs nas kyang ci theg pa khyim du khyer @353a *//
translated: When you are full, take as much as you can carry home.

original: cig / khyed kyis sngar nga'i sha zos te 'grangs pas na /
analyzed: cig / khyed kyis sngar nga'i sha zos te 'grangs pas na /
translated: Because you have eaten my flesh and become full in the past,

original: phyis mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang thog mar khyod chos kyi zas myong bar skya'o //
analyzed: phyis mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang thog mar khyod chos kyi zas myong bar skya'o //
translated: later when I attain manifest enlightenment, I will first let you taste the food of the Dharma.”

original: yul mi dag la gang bkres pa thams cad kyis kyang ci dga' bar nga'i sha la longs shig ces sgos shig /
analyzed: yul mi dag la gang bkres pa thams cad kyis kyang ci dga' bar nga'i sha la longs shig ces sgos shig /
translated: Tell the people of the country that anyone who is hungry may take as much of my flesh as they like.”

original: de'i tshe mi lnga pos sha bcad de zos nas yul mi la sbran te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi lnga pos sha bcad de zos nas yul mi la sbran te /
translated: At that time, the five men cut up the flesh and ate it, and then they announced it to the people of the country.

original: de nas gcig gis gcig la sbran pas 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad 'dus te de'i sha la bcad cing zos so //
analyzed: de nas gcig gis gcig la sbran pas 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad 'dus te de'i sha la bcad cing zos so //
translated: Then one told another, and all the people of Jambudvīpa gathered and cut up his flesh to eat.

original: rtsib logs ngos gcig zad tsam na /
analyzed: rtsib logs ngos gcig zad tsam na /
translated: When one side of his ribs was exhausted,

original: rtsib logs ngos gcig rang bsgyur te; steng ma zad na 'og ma yang de bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: rtsib logs ngos gcig rang bsgyur te; steng ma zad na 'og ma yang de bzhin du skye'o //
translated: he turned over to the other side. When the upper part was exhausted, the lower part grew back in the same way.

original: de bzhin du ltag 'og bsgyur zhing lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du thams cad kyis sha bcad cing zos nas thams cad de la snying rje ba'i sems skyes pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du ltag 'og bsgyur zhing lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du thams cad kyis sha bcad cing zos nas thams cad de la snying rje ba'i sems skyes pas /
translated: In this way, he turned over and over for twelve years, and everyone cut up his flesh to eat. Then everyone gave rise to a compassionate mind toward him.

original: de'i sha zos pa de dag thams cad tshe'i dus byas pa yang mtho ris kyi lhar skyes so //
analyzed: de'i sha zos pa de dag thams cad tshe'i dus byas pa yang mtho ris kyi lhar skyes so //
translated: All those who had eaten his flesh, when their lives ended, were reborn as gods in the heavens.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po nyar gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po nyar gyur pa de ni /
translated: at that time, at that moment, the king who became a tree

original: da ltar nga yin no //
analyzed: da ltar nga yin no //
translated: is now me.

original: shing mkhan lnga po thog mar nga'i sha bcad de zos pa ni /
analyzed: shing mkhan lnga po thog mar nga'i sha bcad de zos pa ni /
translated: The five carpenters who first cut up my flesh to eat

original: dge slong koondi n+ya la sogs pa lnga po yin no //
analyzed: dge slong koondi n+ya la sogs pa lnga po yin no //
translated: are the five, beginning with the bhikṣu Kauṇḍinya.

original: skye bo mang po phyis nga'i sha zos pa ni /
analyzed: skye bo mang po phyis nga'i sha zos pa ni /
translated: The many people who later ate my flesh🔽are the many people who later ate my flesh

original: lha'i sras po brgyad khri dang / nga'i nye gnas rnam par grol ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: lha'i sras po brgyad khri dang / nga'i nye gnas rnam par grol ba rnams yin no //
translated: the eighty thousand sons of the gods, and my disciples who are liberated.

original: de'i tshe na sngar mi lnga po de la byin te 'tsho bas srog bskyabs pas 'dir yang sngar chos bstan te chos kyi sku'i @353b yan lag gis dug gsum gyi me zhi bar byas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sngar mi lnga po de la byin te 'tsho bas srog bskyabs pas 'dir yang sngar chos bstan te chos kyi sku'i @353b yan lag gis dug gsum gyi me zhi bar byas so //
translated: At that time, I first gave to those five people, and by providing for them, I saved their lives. Here as well, I first taught the Dharma, and with the limb of the Dharma body, I extinguished the fire of the three poisons.

original: kun dga' bo dang / 'khor mang po rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la rjes su yi rang nas mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dang / 'khor mang po rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la rjes su yi rang nas mngon par dga'o //
translated: At that time, Ananda and the many assemblies rejoiced and greatly rejoiced in what the World-Honored One had said.

original: shu do la gar ne'u le'u ste nyi shu drug pa'o ////
analyzed: shu do la gar ne'u le'u ste nyi shu drug pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the twenty-sixth chapter, on Sudatta, in the Great Tang Records of the Western Regions.

original: rgyal po aa sho ka'i le'u /
analyzed: rgyal po aa sho ka'i le'u /
translated: Chapter 27: King Asoka

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra pa na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra pa na bzhugs so //
translated: the World-Honored One was dwelling in the Jeta Grove of Anathapindika's Park in Shravasti.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kun dga' bo dang / bsod snyoms la gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kun dga' bo dang / bsod snyoms la gshegs pa las /
translated: At that time, the World-Honored One, together with Ananda, was going out for alms.

original: lam ga na byis pa dag cig sa la khang bu dang / bang mdzod dang / rin po cher bsngos nas rtse zhing 'khod do //
analyzed: lam ga na byis pa dag cig sa la khang bu dang / bang mdzod dang / rin po cher bsngos nas rtse zhing 'khod do //
translated: On the road, some children were playing in the dirt, making houses, treasuries, and precious things.

original: de la khye'u gcig cig gis sangs rgyas rgyang ma nas gshegs pa mthong nas rab tu dga' ste sbyin pa bya bar bsams nas bang ba zhes bsngos pa'i sa las snyim pa gang blangs te sangs rgyas la dpul bar gzas pa las khye'u chung ches pas ma sleb
analyzed: de la khye'u gcig cig gis sangs rgyas rgyang ma nas gshegs pa mthong nas rab tu dga' ste sbyin pa bya bar bsams nas bang ba zhes bsngos pa'i sa las snyim pa gang blangs te sangs rgyas la dpul bar gzas pa las khye'u chung ches pas ma sleb
translated: One of the children saw the Buddha coming from afar, and was very happy. Thinking to make an offering, he took a handful of dirt from the ground that he had designated as a treasury and was about to offer it to the Buddha. But because he was a small child, he could not reach.

original: nas grogs khye'u gcig la khyod sa la sgu zhig /
analyzed: nas grogs khye'u gcig la khyod sa la sgu zhig /
translated: He said to a friend, “You squat down on the ground.

original: kho bo khyod kyi steng du 'greng ste lhung bzed du blug go /
analyzed: kho bo khyod kyi steng du 'greng ste lhung bzed du blug go /
translated: I will stand on your shoulders and put the offering into the Buddha’s alms bowl.”

original: zhes smras nas grogs pos kyang de bzhin du bya'o //🔽zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras nas grogs pos kyang de bzhin du bya'o // zhes smras te /
translated: His friend said, “All right.”

original: khye'u des grogs po'i phrag pa la 'dzegs te sa snyim pa gang sangs rgyas la phul lo //
analyzed: khye'u des grogs po'i phrag pa la 'dzegs te sa snyim pa gang sangs rgyas la phul lo //
translated: The child climbed onto his friend’s shoulders and offered the Buddha a handful of dirt.

original: sangs rgyas kyis kyang lhung bzed smrad nas sa phul ba bzhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kyang lhung bzed smrad nas sa phul ba bzhes so //
translated: The Buddha turned his alms bowl upside down and accepted the offering of dirt.

original: bzhes nas kun dga' bo la gtad de sa 'di 'jim par gyis la gtsug @354a *//
analyzed: bzhes nas kun dga' bo la gtad de sa 'di 'jim par gyis la gtsug @354a *//
translated: He gave it to Ānanda and said, “Make this into clay and make a stūpa.”🔽

original: lag khang la byugs shig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lag khang la byugs shig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having accepted it, he gave it to Ananda and said, Make this earth into mud and plaster the temple with it.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ananda,

original: chung dus dga' ba'i sems kyis nga las phul ba bzhes nas gtsug lag khang la bskus pas /
analyzed: chung dus dga' ba'i sems kyis nga las phul ba bzhes nas gtsug lag khang la bskus pas /
translated: because you accepted the offering from me with a joyful mind when you were young and plastered the temple with it,

original: de'i bsod nams kyis nga mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya lon pa'i 'og tu rgyal po aa sho ka zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams kyis nga mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya lon pa'i 'og tu rgyal po aa sho ka zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by the merit of that, after I have passed into nirvana, one hundred years later, you will become the king called Asoka.

original: khye'u gcig shos ni /
analyzed: khye'u gcig shos ni /
translated: The other boy

original: de'i blon por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i blon por 'gyur te /
translated: will become his minister.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang byed cing dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan kyang yul thams cad du bsgrags nas ring bsrel la yang rgyas par mchod par byed de /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang byed cing dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan kyang yul thams cad du bsgrags nas ring bsrel la yang rgyas par mchod par byed de /
translated: Having proclaimed the virtues of the Three Jewels in all the lands, he will make extensive offerings to the relics,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du mchod rten brgyad khri bzhi stong gcig car byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du mchod rten brgyad khri bzhi stong gcig car byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and in Jambudvipa, he will simultaneously build eighty-four thousand stupas.

original: kun dga' bo dga' mgu rangs nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dga' mgu rangs nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Ananda, delighted and joyful, said to the Bhagavan,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sngon bsod nams ci zhig mdzad pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sngon bsod nams ci zhig mdzad pas /
translated: What merit did the Tathāgata create in the past

original: ring bsrel la yang mchod rten de snyed cig bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: ring bsrel la yang mchod rten de snyed cig bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: that he has so many stūpas for his relics?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rtag par nyon la shin tu yid la zungs shig dang / khyod la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag par nyon la shin tu yid la zungs shig dang / khyod la bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Listen constantly and keep this in your mind well, and I will teach it to you.

original: sngon bskal pa grangs med pa 'das pa na 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir rgyal po gsal thub zhes bya ba /
analyzed: sngon bskal pa grangs med pa 'das pa na 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir rgyal po gsal thub zhes bya ba /
translated: In the past, beyond countless eons, in this Jambudvīpa there was a king named Viśvāmitra,

original: rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed la dbang byed pa zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed la dbang byed pa zhig byung ngo //
translated: who ruled over eighty-four thousand vassal states.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas bur sha zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas bur sha zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: At that time, a buddha named Vipaśyin appeared in the world.

original: rgyal po des blon po dang bcas su yo byad rnam pa bzhi @354b sbyar te sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la phul lo //
analyzed: rgyal po des blon po dang bcas su yo byad rnam pa bzhi @354b sbyar te sangs rgyas dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun la phul lo //
translated: That king, together with his ministers, prepared the four kinds of offerings and presented them to the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po de dang / yul mi rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po de dang / yul mi rnams ni /
translated: At that time, the king and the people of the country

original: rtag tu sangs rgyas dang phrad de phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed kyi /
analyzed: rtag tu sangs rgyas dang phrad de phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed kyi /
translated: He always met the Buddha, paid homage to him, and served him.

original: rgyal phran gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: rgyal phran gzhan dag ni /
translated: The other minor kings

original: bsod nams kyang mi byed pas mtha' 'khob kyi rgyal phran dang / yul mi dag bsod nams byed du gzhug pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs bris la rgyal phran rnams la sbyin no snyam bsams nas ri mo mkhan mang po bsdus te sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs ri mo la bris shig ces bsgo ba dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyang mi byed pas mtha' 'khob kyi rgyal phran dang / yul mi dag bsod nams byed du gzhug pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs bris la rgyal phran rnams la sbyin no snyam bsams nas ri mo mkhan mang po bsdus te sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs ri mo la bris shig ces bsgo ba dang /
translated: did not make merit. In order to make the people of the minor kingdoms in the borderlands make merit, he thought he would have Buddha images painted and give them to the minor kings. He gathered many painters and ordered them, “Paint Buddha images on canvas.”

original: ri mo mkhan dag sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar song ste sangs rgyas kyi mtshan bltas nas ri mo bris pa las mtshan gcig bris na gcig mi 'dra bar gyur te /
analyzed: ri mo mkhan dag sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar song ste sangs rgyas kyi mtshan bltas nas ri mo bris pa las mtshan gcig bris na gcig mi 'dra bar gyur te /
translated: The painters went before the Buddha and looked at his marks. They painted the Buddha’s marks, but when they painted one mark, another one was different.

original: ri mo mkhan gyis ri mo bri bar ma nus so //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan gyis ri mo bri bar ma nus so //
translated: The painters were unable to paint the image.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyis tshon rtsi sbyar te sku gzugs gcig bris nas ri mo mkhan rnams de la bltas te sku gzugs mtshan dang ldan pa brgyad khri bzhi stong bris nas rgyal phran re re la sku gzugs re re bskur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyis tshon rtsi sbyar te sku gzugs gcig bris nas ri mo mkhan rnams de la bltas te sku gzugs mtshan dang ldan pa brgyad khri bzhi stong bris nas rgyal phran re re la sku gzugs re re bskur te /
translated: The Buddha himself mixed the paints and drew one picture. The painters, looking at it, drew eighty-four thousand other pictures of the Buddha.

original: sku gzugs de la rgyal po dang / yul mi thams cad kyis me tog dang / spos dang / yo byad thams cad kyis mchod de phyag 'tshol cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs de la rgyal po dang / yul mi thams cad kyis me tog dang / spos dang / yo byad thams cad kyis mchod de phyag 'tshol cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: He ordered that each of the vassal kings should receive one of the pictures, and that all the kings and their subjects should worship the pictures with flowers, incense, and all kinds of offerings, and should bow down to them.

original: rgyal phran de dag dang / yul mi de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs mthong nas rab tu dga' mgu rangs te bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: rgyal phran de dag dang / yul mi de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs mthong nas rab tu dga' mgu rangs te bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: When the vassal kings and their subjects saw the pictures of the Tathagata, they were filled with joy and worshiped them.

original: de'i tshe na rgyal po gsal thub de ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe na rgyal po gsal thub de ni /
translated: At that time, the king Prasenajit🔽was myself.

original: de ltar nga yin te /🔽de ltar de bzhin gshegs @355a *//
analyzed: de ltar nga yin te /🔽de ltar de bzhin gshegs @355a *//
translated: Thus,

original: pa'i sku gzugs brgyad khri bzhi stong bris te rgyal phran kun la spel ba'i bsod nams kyis gang nas gang du skyes kyang mtho ris su brgya byin lha'i dbang por skyes te byad gzugs bzang ba dang / mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu thob ste mngon par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: pa'i sku gzugs brgyad khri bzhi stong bris te rgyal phran kun la spel ba'i bsod nams kyis gang nas gang du skyes kyang mtho ris su brgya byin lha'i dbang por skyes te byad gzugs bzang ba dang / mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu thob ste mngon par sangs rgyas so //
translated: By the merit of having caused eighty-four thousand images to be made and distributed throughout the kingdom, wherever he was born, he was born in the heavens as Sakra, Lord of the Gods, with a beautiful form, the thirty-two major marks, and the eighty minor marks of a Buddha, and he attained perfect Buddhahood.

original: mya ngan las 'das nas kyang ring bsrel la mchod rten brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das nas kyang ring bsrel la mchod rten brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: And after his Nirvana, there will be eighty-four thousand stupas built for his relics.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces gsungs pa la kun dga' bo dang / 'khor mang po mngon par dga' nas rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces gsungs pa la kun dga' bo dang / 'khor mang po mngon par dga' nas rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: Ananda and the multitude rejoiced in the words of the Blessed One and praised his teaching.

original: rgyal po aa sho ka'i le'u ste nyi shu bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: rgyal po aa sho ka'i le'u ste nyi shu bdun pa'o ////
translated: This is the twenty-seventh chapter, the Chapter on King Asoka.

original: gser gyi bum pa'i le'u /
analyzed: gser gyi bum pa'i le'u /
translated: Chapter on the Golden Urn

original: 'di skad bdag gis thogs pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thogs pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe dge slong dag dbyar so sor tshul du zhugs nas tshul nas byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der lhags so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dag dbyar so sor tshul du zhugs nas tshul nas byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der lhags so //
translated: At that time, the monks, having entered the rainy season retreat separately, came to where the Blessed One was staying after emerging from the retreat.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong dag dang yun ring du ma phrad pas de dag la thugs rtse bar dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong dag dang yun ring du ma phrad pas de dag la thugs rtse bar dgongs te /
translated: The Blessed One, not having seen the monks for a long time, thought to show them affection.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i phyag bteg ste dge slong de dag la bsti stang dang bcas pas khyed na bar ma gyur tam /
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i phyag bteg ste dge slong de dag la bsti stang dang bcas pas khyed na bar ma gyur tam /
translated: He raised his hand with its thousand-spoked wheel and, with respect, asked the monks, “Have you not been sick?

original: bsod snyoms kyis brel tam zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de bzhin gshegs @355b pa yon tan chen po dang ldan pa de /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyis brel tam zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de bzhin gshegs @355b pa yon tan chen po dang ldan pa de /
translated: Have you not been in want of alms?”

original: dge slong rnams la bsti stang mdzad par dge slong kun dga' bos mthong nas ngo mtshar du gyur te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bsti stang mdzad par dge slong kun dga' bos mthong nas ngo mtshar du gyur te bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The monk Ānanda, seeing the Thus-Gone One, who possesses great qualities, showing respect to the monks, was amazed and said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One, it is amazing!

original: bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: The Blessed One is

original: 'jig rten gyi gtso bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gtso bo //
translated: the foremost in the world,

original: yon tan dpag tu ma mchis pa /
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu ma mchis pa /
translated: with immeasurable virtues,

original: ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa lags na /
analyzed: ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa lags na /
translated: and inconceivable wisdom.

original: ci'i slad du thugs smad de dge slong rnams la bsti stang mdzad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ci'i slad du thugs smad de dge slong rnams la bsti stang mdzad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Why do you disparage yourself and revere the monks? The Blessed One said to Ānanda,

original: sngon bskal pa grangs med tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'das pa na 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir yul w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag so tshis la mkhas pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: sngon bskal pa grangs med tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'das pa na 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir yul w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag so tshis la mkhas pa zhig yod de /
translated: In the past, countless, limitless, inconceivable eons ago, in this Jambudvīpa, in the country of Vārāṇasī, there was a householder skilled in managing finances.

original: nor ci rnyed kyang gser du bsgyur nas gser gyi bum pa gcig byas te sa 'og tu sbas so //
analyzed: nor ci rnyed kyang gser du bsgyur nas gser gyi bum pa gcig byas te sa 'og tu sbas so //
translated: Whatever wealth he acquired, he turned it into gold, made a golden vase, and buried it underground.

original: de bzhin du nor rdzas ci rnyed kyang lus la mi spyod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du nor rdzas ci rnyed kyang lus la mi spyod de /
translated: In the same way, whatever wealth he acquired, he did not use it on himself.

original: gser du bsgyur nas phyis ring zhig lon pa dang / gser gyi bum pa snga phyir bsags pa bdun du gyur nas thams cad sa 'og tu sbas so //
analyzed: gser du bsgyur nas phyis ring zhig lon pa dang / gser gyi bum pa snga phyir bsags pa bdun du gyur nas thams cad sa 'og tu sbas so //
translated: After a long time, whatever gold he had accumulated earlier and later became seven golden vases, all of which he buried underground.

original: khyim bdag de phyis nad kyis btab nas tshe dus byas pa dang / gser gyi bum pa la chags pas sbrul gdug pa zhig tu skyes te gser de la srung ngo //
analyzed: khyim bdag de phyis nad kyis btab nas tshe dus byas pa dang / gser gyi bum pa la chags pas sbrul gdug pa zhig tu skyes te gser de la srung ngo //
translated: Later, the householder became ill and died. Because of his attachment to the golden pot, he was reborn as a poisonous snake and guarded the gold.

original: phyis yun ring zhig lon pa dang / grong khyer de yang zhig nas su yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyis yun ring zhig lon pa dang / grong khyer de yang zhig nas su yang mi gnas te /
translated: After a long time, the city was destroyed and no one lived there.

original: sa stong du gyur to //
analyzed: sa stong du gyur to //
translated: It became an empty place.

original: sbrul de yang lo grangs mang du lon pas tshe'i dus byas nas phyir yang de nyid kyi lus su skyes te gser gyi bum pa la 'khri @356a *//🔽zhing nyal lo //
analyzed: sbrul de yang lo grangs mang du lon pas tshe'i dus byas nas phyir yang de nyid kyi lus su skyes te gser gyi bum pa la 'khri @356a *// zhing nyal lo //
translated: The snake also died after many years and was reborn in the same body, clinging to and sleeping on the golden pot.

original: de bzhin du lo khri phrag du ma lon pa dang / nang gi skye ba tha ma la lus des skyo ste 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du lo khri phrag du ma lon pa dang / nang gi skye ba tha ma la lus des skyo ste 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: In this way, after many tens of thousands of years, in his final birth, he became weary of that body and thought like this:

original: bdag ni / gser 'di la chags pas 'di 'dra ba'i lus la mi sdug pa myong bar gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / gser 'di la chags pas 'di 'dra ba'i lus la mi sdug pa myong bar gyur gyi /
translated: Because of my attachment to this gold, I have experienced such an ugly body.

original: da ni / bsod nams kyi zhing la phul nas lam dang nye bar song ste rtsva khrod du lus spas la mi dag 'ongs nas 'bod do snyam ste /
analyzed: da ni / bsod nams kyi zhing la phul nas lam dang nye bar song ste rtsva khrod du lus spas la mi dag 'ongs nas 'bod do snyam ste /
translated: Now, having given to the field of merit, he has come near the path and is spreading out his body in the grass.

original: de'i tshe sbrul gdug pa des mi gcig lam nas 'ong ba mthong nas sbrul gyis mi de la bos pa dang / mi des bos pa'i dgra thos nas phan tshun bltas na cang mi snang bas lam du zhugs te song song ba las /
analyzed: de'i tshe sbrul gdug pa des mi gcig lam nas 'ong ba mthong nas sbrul gyis mi de la bos pa dang / mi des bos pa'i dgra thos nas phan tshun bltas na cang mi snang bas lam du zhugs te song song ba las /
translated: At that time, the poisonous snake saw a man coming along the path. The snake called out to the man, and the man, hearing the voice of the one who had called out to him, looked around, but seeing nothing, entered the path and went on.

original: sbrul gyis yang bos te /
analyzed: sbrul gyis yang bos te /
translated: The snake called out again.

original: kye kho bo'i drung du snyen cig ces smras so //
analyzed: kye kho bo'i drung du snyen cig ces smras so //
translated: “Hey, come to me!”

original: mi des smras pa /
analyzed: mi des smras pa /
translated: The man said,

original: khyod kyis kho bo bos te ci zhig bya /
analyzed: khyod kyis kho bo bos te ci zhig bya /
translated: “What do you want from me by calling me?

original: khyod ni / shin tu gdug pa can yin pas; kho bo gsad du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: khyod ni / shin tu gdug pa can yin pas; kho bo gsad du 'ong ngo //
translated: You are very poisonous, so you must be coming to kill me.”

original: sbrul gyis smras pa /
analyzed: sbrul gyis smras pa /
translated: The snake said,

original: kho bos gnod pa bya na /
analyzed: kho bos gnod pa bya na /
translated: “If I wanted to harm you,

original: khyod drung du ma 'ongs kyang gnod pa bya nus so //
analyzed: khyod drung du ma 'ongs kyang gnod pa bya nus so //
translated: I could do it even without your coming to me.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / mi de skrag nas sprul gyi drung du bsnyen to //
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / mi de skrag nas sprul gyi drung du bsnyen to //
translated: The man was frightened and went to the snake.

original: sbrul gyis smras pa /
analyzed: sbrul gyis smras pa /
translated: The snake said,

original: kho bo la 'di na gser gyi bum pa zhig yod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo la 'di na gser gyi bum pa zhig yod kyi /
translated: “I have a pot of gold here.

original: khyod la bsod nams shig bya bar bcol na nus sam /
analyzed: khyod la bsod nams shig bya bar bcol na nus sam /
translated: If you agree to do a meritorious deed for me, I can do it.

original: ci ste ma byas na khyod la gnod pa bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste ma byas na khyod la gnod pa bya'o //
translated: If you don’t do it, I will harm you.”

original: mi des kho bos nus so //
analyzed: mi des kho bos nus so //
translated: The man said, “I can do it.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / sbrul gyis mi de gser gyi bum pa'i drung du khrid de /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / sbrul gyis mi de gser gyi bum pa'i drung du khrid de /
translated: The snake led the man to the pot of gold.

original: gser gyi bum pa gcig bskur te 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gser gyi bum pa gcig bskur te 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He gave him the pot of gold and said,

original: khyod gser 'di @356b khyer la dge 'dun rnams la mchod ston zhig gsol cig /
analyzed: khyod gser 'di @356b khyer la dge 'dun rnams la mchod ston zhig gsol cig /
translated: “Take this gold and make an offering to the saṅgha.

original: mchod ston gsol ba'i nyin par kho bos kyang 'ong gi /
analyzed: mchod ston gsol ba'i nyin par kho bos kyang 'ong gi /
translated: On the day of the offering, I will also come.

original: bsus shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: bsus shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Please welcome me.”

original: de nas mi de gser khur du khyer te dge 'dun gyi gnas su song nas dge slong gi gtsang sbyor la gser phul te /
analyzed: de nas mi de gser khur du khyer te dge 'dun gyi gnas su song nas dge slong gi gtsang sbyor la gser phul te /
translated: Then the man took the gold and went to the saṅgha’s dwelling place. He gave the gold to the saṅgha’s steward and said,

original: 'di ni / sbrul gdug pa zhig gi gser lags kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni / sbrul gdug pa zhig gi gser lags kyi /
translated: “This is the gold of a poisonous snake.

original: gser 'dis dge 'dun la mchod ston gsol cig ces mchi'o //
analyzed: gser 'dis dge 'dun la mchod ston gsol cig ces mchi'o //
translated: Please use this gold to make an offering to the saṅgha.”

original: gser 'dis mchod ston sbyar te mchod ston nam gsol bzhag dus brtsis nas de'i nyin par mi de gzeb cig thogs te sbrul gdug pa de gang na 'dug pa der song ngo //
analyzed: gser 'dis mchod ston sbyar te mchod ston nam gsol bzhag dus brtsis nas de'i nyin par mi de gzeb cig thogs te sbrul gdug pa de gang na 'dug pa der song ngo //
translated: The man who had been sent to catch the snake thought, I will make an offering with this gold and when the offering is made, I will count the days and on that day I will take a basket and go to where the poisonous snake is.

original: sbrul gdug pa des kyang mi de 'ong ba mthong nas rab tu dga' bar gyur te mi des sbrul gzeb kyi nang du bcug nas khyer te song ba las /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa des kyang mi de 'ong ba mthong nas rab tu dga' bar gyur te mi des sbrul gzeb kyi nang du bcug nas khyer te song ba las /
translated: The poisonous snake also saw the man coming and was very happy. The man put the snake in a basket and carried it away.

original: lam du mi zhig dang phrad de /
analyzed: lam du mi zhig dang phrad de /
translated: On the way, he met a man.

original: mi des khyod gang nas 'ongs zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris kyang sbrul thogs pa des cang ma smras pas /
analyzed: mi des khyod gang nas 'ongs zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris kyang sbrul thogs pa des cang ma smras pas /
translated: The man asked him, Where are you coming from? up to three times, but the man carrying the snake did not say anything.

original: sbrul de khros nas gdug pa byung ba las yang 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: sbrul de khros nas gdug pa byung ba las yang 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: The snake became angry and its poison came out. Again, he thought like this:

original: mi 'di ci zhig nyes na pha rol pos lan gsum gyi bar du dris na /
analyzed: mi 'di ci zhig nyes na pha rol pos lan gsum gyi bar du dris na /
translated: What is wrong with this man that when asked up to three times by the other person,

original: gtam gyi lan yang mi ster snyam ste phyir yang khros nas gdug pa phyung ba las phyir bkag ste yang 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: gtam gyi lan yang mi ster snyam ste phyir yang khros nas gdug pa phyung ba las phyir bkag ste yang 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: he does not give an answer? Again, he became angry and his poison came out, but he stopped it and thought like this:

original: mi 'di bdag gi phyir bsod nams byed na /
analyzed: mi 'di bdag gi phyir bsod nams byed na /
translated: If this man makes merit for my sake,🔽I will remember his kindness and repay it. I will not kill him.

original: byas pa gzo ba'i drin yang dran par byas pas gdug pa mi dbyung ngo snyam bsams te mi 'di bdag la phan pha'i don byed kyi /🔽nyes pa zhig byas @357a *//
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba'i drin yang dran par byas pas gdug pa mi dbyung ngo snyam bsams te mi 'di bdag la phan pha'i don byed kyi / nyes pa zhig byas @357a *//
translated: He thought, This man is doing what is beneficial for me.

original: na yang bzod par bya'o //
analyzed: na yang bzod par bya'o //
translated: Even if he has done something wrong, I will forgive him.🔽 He went to a secluded place and said, Please put it down for a moment.

original: zhes dben par phyin pa dang / re zhig sa la zhog cig ces smras nas mi des sbrul de la sems smad de bdag gi nyes pa 'gyod cing bshags so //
analyzed: zhes dben par phyin pa dang / re zhig sa la zhog cig ces smras nas mi des sbrul de la sems smad de bdag gi nyes pa 'gyod cing bshags so //
translated: The man scolded the snake and confessed his wrongdoing.

original: zhes smras nas phyir yang khur du khyer te dge 'dun gyi gnas su phyin pa dang / dge 'dun dag kyang gdugs tshod kyi dus la bab pas /
analyzed: zhes smras nas phyir yang khur du khyer te dge 'dun gyi gnas su phyin pa dang / dge 'dun dag kyang gdugs tshod kyi dus la bab pas /
translated: He said, I will carry you again. He returned to the saṅgha's residence, and the saṅgha also came to the time of the meal.

original: mi des dge 'dun la me tog brims te sbrul de dad pa'i sems kyis me tog 'brim pa la blta'o //
analyzed: mi des dge 'dun la me tog brims te sbrul de dad pa'i sems kyis me tog 'brim pa la blta'o //
translated: The man scattered flowers to the saṅgha and watched the snake scattering flowers with a faithful mind.

original: de nas dge 'dun dag zas kyi bya ba byas nas kha lag bkrus te sbrul de la chos bshad do; ;sbrul de rab tu dga' nas gser gyi bum pa drug kyang dge 'dun la phul te bsod nams kyi las byas nas de nas tshe 'phos so //
analyzed: de nas dge 'dun dag zas kyi bya ba byas nas kha lag bkrus te sbrul de la chos bshad do; ;sbrul de rab tu dga' nas gser gyi bum pa drug kyang dge 'dun la phul te bsod nams kyi las byas nas de nas tshe 'phos so //
translated: Then the Sangha, having finished their meal and washed their hands and bowls, preached the Dharma for the snake. The snake was greatly pleased and gave the Sangha six golden vases. Having done meritorious deeds, he then passed away.

original: tshe'i dus byas nas de'i bsod nams kyis sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar skyes so //
analyzed: tshe'i dus byas nas de'i bsod nams kyis sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lhar skyes so //
translated: When his life had ended, because of his merit he was reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽de'i tshe na sbrul gdug pa khur du khyer ba'i mi de ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / de'i tshe na sbrul gdug pa khur du khyer ba'i mi de ni /
translated: Ananda,

original: da ltar nga yin no //
analyzed: da ltar nga yin no //
translated: the man who carried the poisonous snake in his arms at that time was me.

original: sbrul gdug pa de ni /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa de ni /
translated: The poisonous snake was

original: sh'a ri'i bu yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yin no //
translated: Sariputra.

original: 'das pa'i dus na yang khur du sbrul khyer ba las sbrul gyis spyos te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yang khur du sbrul khyer ba las sbrul gyis spyos te /
translated: In a past life, because of carrying a snake in his arms, he was scolded by the snake.

original: de la yang sems smad pas da yang dge slong rnams la sems smad pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang sems smad pas da yang dge slong rnams la sems smad pa yin no //
translated: Because he despised him then, he now despises the bhiksus.

original: kun dga' bo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la yi rang nas mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la yi rang nas mngon par dga'o //
translated: Ananda and the others rejoiced in the Buddha's words.

analyzed: gser gyi bum pa'i le'u ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o ////

analyzed: phyir khyim du 'ongs nas zhal zas sbyar te 'phags pa rnams spyan drangs nas bshos gsol te /

analyzed: de'i tshe bram ze de'i chung ma bde ba zhes bya ba des dge 'dun la @358a *//
translated: At that time, the brahmin's wife named Kṣema gave

analyzed: btson des rgyal po gshegs pa mthong nas dus te kha zas shig bslangs pa dang / rgyal pos kyang sbyin no //

analyzed: gcig kyang 'gro phod pa med de /
translated: there was not a single person in the palace who dared go.

analyzed: nam phyed na kha zas bskur du lam na 'dre gdon dang / srin pos 'jigs pas srog dang bsdos te 'gro nus pa med do //

translated: At that time, the king remembered the suffering and hunger of that man and felt great compassion for him. He said, In my country, if anyone can take food to that prisoner, I will give them a thousand ounces of gold.

original: zhes bsgrags kyang 'gro nus pa ma byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bsgrags kyang 'gro nus pa ma byung ngo //

original: de'i tshe bram ze'i chung ma bde ba des gtam du thos na 'jig rten pa su yang rung sta nyin zhag gcig pa'i bslab tshigs brgyad mnos na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bram ze'i chung ma bde ba des gtam du thos na 'jig rten pa su yang rung sta nyin zhag gcig pa'i bslab tshigs brgyad mnos na /
translated: If any worldly person takes the eight precepts for one day and one night,

original: 'dre gdon la sogs pas mi brdzi ste /
analyzed: 'dre gdon la sogs pas mi brdzi ste /

original: gdon thams cad kyis gnod pa byed mi nus so //
analyzed: gdon thams cad kyis gnod pa byed mi nus so //

original: zhes thos kyi /
analyzed: zhes thos kyi /

analyzed: de nas rgyal pos bde ba la khyod kha zas 'di dag khyer la che ge mo zhig na btson 'dug pa de la byin cig dang / gser srang stong sbyin no //
translated: Then the king said to Kṣemavatī, Take this food and give it to the prisoner in such-and-such a place, and I will give you a thousand gold coins.

original: zhes dam bcas so //
analyzed: zhes dam bcas so //
translated: He made this promise.

original: de nas bde ba rgyal po'i bka' bzhin du kha zas thogs te tshul khrims dran par byas nas lam du zhugs te song song ba las /
analyzed: de nas bde ba rgyal po'i bka' bzhin du kha zas thogs te tshul khrims dran par byas nas lam du zhugs te song song ba las /
translated: Then Kṣemavatī, in accordance with the king's command, took the food, remembered the precepts, and set out on the road.

analyzed: grong khyer gyi phyi rol tu srin mo lam pa dang phrad do //

analyzed: de'i tshe bsnyen gnas ma tshul khrims ma nyams pas srin mos mthong nas phyir skrag ste /
translated: At that time, the upāsikā was observing the upavāsa. Her moral discipline was unimpaired. When the rākṣasī saw her, she was frightened and said,

analyzed: bsnyen gnas ma khyod khyer ba'i kha zas las cung zad cig bslang ngo //
translated: “Upāsikā, I want to ask you for a little of the food you are carrying.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / bsnyen gnas mas kyang nyung du zhig byin te byin pa nyung mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / bsnyen gnas mas kyang nyung du zhig byin te byin pa nyung mod kyi /
translated: The upāsikā gave her a little. Although what she gave was small,

analyzed: srin mo'i mthus mang du sprul pas srin mo ma smad shin tu 'grangs par gyur to //
translated: through the power of the rākṣasī it multiplied and the rākṣasī and her children were completely satisfied.

analyzed: de nas srin mos bsnyen gnas ma la khyod kyi ming ci zhes dris pa dang / kho mo ni /
translated: Then the rākṣasī asked the upāsikā, “What is your name?”🔽She said, “I am called ‘Happiness.’

original: bde ba'o // zhes smras so //
analyzed: bde ba'o // zhes smras so //
translated: It is bliss.”🔽

analyzed: 'o na kho mo ma smad kyang ltogs pa las khyod kyis gsos kyi /

analyzed: kho mo 'dug pa 'di na gser bum pa gang yod kyi phyir log pa'i lam du khyer cig /

analyzed: khyod phar 'gro na kho mo'i nu mo aa lam pa yang lam ga na 'dug ste khyod dang phrad kyi /

original: kho mo'i 'phrin du khyod bde'am /
analyzed: kho mo'i 'phrin du khyod bde'am /

original: kho mo yang bu lnga brgya bde bar @359a *//
analyzed: kho mo yang bu lnga brgya bde bar @359a *//

original: btsas so // zhes gyis shig /
analyzed: btsas so // zhes gyis shig /

analyzed: aa lampal bu mo'i 'phrin spring pa dang / bu lnga brgya bde bar btsas so //

original: zhes gtam byas pas aa lampa dga' ste /
analyzed: zhes gtam byas pas aa lampa dga' ste /
translated: Alambuṣā was delighted.

original: bsnyen gnas ma la khyod kyis kho mo'i phu mo'i 'phrin dang gtam snyan byas pa legs kyi /
analyzed: bsnyen gnas ma la khyod kyis kho mo'i phu mo'i 'phrin dang gtam snyan byas pa legs kyi /

analyzed: kho mo 'dug pa'i gnas 'di na gser bum pa gang yod kyi phyir log pa'i las du khyer cig /

original: kho mo cag gi ming po gcig kyang lam ga na 'dug gi /
analyzed: kho mo cag gi ming po gcig kyang lam ga na 'dug gi /
translated: None of their brothers are here.

analyzed: de dang phrad na kho mo cag spun gnyis kyi 'phrin dang / bu lnga brgya btsas pa'i gtam yang gyis shig ces bsgo nas song ngo //
translated: If you meet them, give them this message from their two sisters and tell them that their five hundred sons have been born safely.”🔽After a while they met the brothers of the two rākṣasīs.

original: de nas yang ring por ma phyin par srin mo gnyis kyi ming po dang phrad de; de la srin mo gnyis kyi 'phrin dang bu lnga brgya yang bde bar btsas pa'i gtam byas nas de yang rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: de nas yang ring por ma phyin par srin mo gnyis kyi ming po dang phrad de; de la srin mo gnyis kyi 'phrin dang bu lnga brgya yang bde bar btsas pa'i gtam byas nas de yang rab tu dga' ste /
translated: They gave them the message from their two sisters and told them that their five hundred sons had been born safely. They were overjoyed.🔽“You have brought us a message from our two sisters.

original: khyod kyis kho bo'i sring mo gnyis kyi 'phrin byas pa legs kyi; kho bo 'dug pa'i gnas 'di na gser bum pa gang yod kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyis kho bo'i sring mo gnyis kyi 'phrin byas pa legs kyi; kho bo 'dug pa'i gnas 'di na gser bum pa gang yod kyi /

original: phyir ldog pa'i lam du khyer cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa'i lam du khyer cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Take it with you on your return.”

analyzed: de nas bsnyen gnas ma chas te song song ba las btson de'i drung du phyin te kha zas bsnyod nas phyir ldog pa'i lam du gser bum pa gsum yang rnyed do //

analyzed: rgyal pos kyang gser srang stong bya dgar byin pas /
