analyzed: bram ze dbul po @359b khyo shug gnyis yul de na shin tu phyug cing nor mang bar gyur pas lhag par bsod nams byed cing rin po che mang bar gyur to //
translated: The poor Brahman couple became very rich in that country, and their wealth increased. They did much good and had many jewels.

original: rgyal pos kyang de bsod nams las gyur par shes nas blon por bcug ste shin tu phyug par gyur pas /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang de bsod nams las gyur par shes nas blon por bcug ste shin tu phyug par gyur pas /
translated: The king knew that this was the result of their merit, and he made them ministers. They became very rich.

original: lhag par bsod nams byed pa la dad pa'i sems skyes te sangs rgyas dang / dge 'dun spyan drangs nas mchod pa chen po byas so; ;de la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pas sems rnam par grol te rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: lhag par bsod nams byed pa la dad pa'i sems skyes te sangs rgyas dang / dge 'dun spyan drangs nas mchod pa chen po byas so; ;de la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pas sems rnam par grol te rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: They especially believed in doing good works. They invited the Buddha and the Sangha and made great offerings. The Bhagavat taught them the Dharma, and their minds were liberated. They attained the fruit of stream-winner.

original: 'khor mang po dang / kun dga' bo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la rjes su yi rang nas mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: 'khor mang po dang / kun dga' bo la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la rjes su yi rang nas mngon par dga'o //
translated: The great assembly and Ananda and the others rejoiced in what the Buddha had said.

original: bram ze mo bde ba'i le'u ste nyi shu dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: bram ze mo bde ba'i le'u ste nyi shu dgu pa'o ////
translated: This is the twenty-ninth chapter, the chapter on the Brahman lady Kshanti.

original: bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Chapter Thirty

original: sbyin pa chen po rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i le'u /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po rgya mtshor zhugs pa'i le'u /
translated: The chapter on the Great Giver's voyage on the ocean.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong chen po'i dge 'dun brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum dang thabs cig tu bzhugs so //
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha together with a great saṅgha of one thousand, thirteen hundred monks.

analyzed: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun shes koondi n+ya la sogs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i g-yog cig dgos so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya and others, I need an attendant to serve me.

original: zhes bka' stsal pa dang / de nas kun shes koondi n+ya stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das la bdag @360a *//

translated: Then Ājñātakauṇḍinya rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: gis bsnyen bkur yid bzhin du bgyi zhing chos gos dang lhung bzed gzung ngo //
translated: Blessed One, I will serve you as you wish and hold your Dharma robes and alms bowl.

analyzed: zhes gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis koondi n+ya la khyod kyang rgas 'khogs te khyod nyid la yang bsnyen bkur byed pa dgos kyi /
translated: The Buddha said to Kauṇḍinya, You are old and decrepit. You need someone to serve you.

original: koondi n+ya khyod stan la 'dug cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: koondi n+ya khyod stan la 'dug cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Kauṇḍinya, you should sit down.

original: de bzhin du 'od srung dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / moo gal yan la sogs pa nye gnas lnga brgya snyed kun gyis bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od srung dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / moo gal yan la sogs pa nye gnas lnga brgya snyed kun gyis bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //
translated: In the same way, Kāśyapa, Śāriputra, Maudgalyāyana, and the other five hundred disciples all said, “We will serve the Bhagavān.”

original: zhes gsol na yang gcig kyang ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: zhes gsol na yang gcig kyang ma gnang ngo //
translated: But none of them were allowed.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas /
translated: Then the venerable Aniruddha

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsnyen bkur byed pa'i dge slong gang la dgyes snyam du brtags na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kun dga' bo la dgyes pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kun dga' bo la dgyes pa ni /
translated: He examined the Bhagavān’s mind and saw that it was Kauṇḍinya.

original: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'di skad du bdag cag la pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu smad dang / gnyen bshes ma mchis pas sdug go /

analyzed: zhes zer ro; ;de la kha cig ni /

analyzed: bdag cag yun ring du nad kyis btab pas mi sos te sdug go /

analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de la kha cig ni /

analyzed: sbyin pa chen pos ae ma ho 'di dag ci byed ces dris na / bdag cag ni /

analyzed: pha mes rgyud @363b kyis 'di 'dri ba'i gsod pa'i las byed de / 'di ma byas na mi 'tsho'o //

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //

translated: The Great Giver was amazed. He went a little farther and saw hunters setting snares and traps and killing birds. He saw sentient beings caught in the snares and traps. Their bodies were shaking and pulling, but they could not escape. They were crying out in compassion, and they were very frightened. He asked, “What are you doing?”

analyzed: bdag cag rgyud kyis las gzhan mi byed kyi /

analyzed: tshe 'phos ma thag tu ngan song gsum du lhung ste mun pa nas mun par 'gro zhing thar pa'i dus med do snyam bsams nas phyir khyim du 'ongs te nyin mtshan du de sems shing mi dga' nas pha'i drung du song ste pha la bdag gsol ba zhig
translated: ” Having thought this, he returned home and day and night brooded on it, becoming unhappy. He went to his father and said, “I have a request to make.

analyzed: mchis kyi; gnong zhig ces smras so //

original: phas kyang bu /
analyzed: phas kyang bu /
translated: His father said, “Son,

analyzed: khyod ci zer /

analyzed: khyod smra ba bzhin du bya'o // zhes smras so //

analyzed: gcig la gcig gsod pa dang / rdzun dang / dbang za ba dang / mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs bgyid pa mthong nas de dag la sbyin pa bgyid par bsams kyi /

analyzed: phan tshun skyes bskur ba dang / tshong zong ci las bya zhes smras so //

analyzed: kho bo'i bu sdug ches te ngo mi ldog pas smra mi phod kyi /
translated: “I love my son so much that I cannot bear to see him. I cannot speak.

analyzed: khyod bdag gis thabs ci legs su byos la brel cing mi khom pa ltar tha snyad thogs shig /

analyzed: mdzod srung gis bram ze las lung thob nas mdzod sgo bcad de don gnyer du song ngo //

analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa 'di ni /

analyzed: mdzod srung gis thugs mi thub pas pha'i man ngag 'ongs kyi /

analyzed: yong yang bus pha'i bang mdzod stongs par bya bar mi rigs kyi /
translated: It is not right for a son to empty his father’s treasury.

analyzed: bdag gis da thabs ci zhig byas na /

analyzed: 'jig rten na las ci zhig byas na /

original: 'jig rten na dbul 'phongs pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dbul 'phongs pa dag ni /
translated: His parents, hearing these words, were distressed and said to their son, “In this world, the poor and needy

analyzed: blo med de /

analyzed: lus dang srog dang bsngos nas 'gro bar byed do //

original: khyod cis phongs nas de lta bur sems /
analyzed: khyod cis phongs nas de lta bur sems /

original: khyod sbyin pa byed 'dod na /
analyzed: khyod sbyin pa byed 'dod na /
translated: If you want to give,

original: khyim na yod pa'i nor thams cad sbyin par byos shig /🔽rgya mtshor ni /
analyzed: khyim na yod pa'i nor thams cad sbyin par byos shig / rgya mtshor ni /
translated: Give away all the wealth in the house.

original: 'gror mi rung ste /🔽rgya mtsho'i nang na chu rlabs @366a *//
analyzed: 'gror mi rung ste / rgya mtsho'i nang na chu rlabs @366a *//
translated: “It is not right to go to the ocean.🔽In the ocean there are many great obstacles, such as🔽water, waves,🔽whirlpools, sea monsters,

original: dang / dba' klong 'khyil ba dang / chu srin dang / klu gdug pa dang / srin mo dang / ri chu'i mdog can la sogs te shin tu yang ba'i bgegs mang du yod pas thar par dka' na /
analyzed: dang / dba' klong 'khyil ba dang / chu srin dang / klu gdug pa dang / srin mo dang / ri chu'i mdog can la sogs te shin tu yang ba'i bgegs mang du yod pas thar par dka' na /
translated: evil nāgas, rākṣasīs, mountains of water, and so forth. It is difficult to escape.

original: khyod cis phongs nas srog dang bsngo bar byed /🔽'di la ni /
analyzed: khyod cis phongs nas srog dang bsngo bar byed / 'di la ni /
translated: What is your need that you would risk your life?

original: nyan pa med kyi /
analyzed: nyan pa med kyi /
translated: There is no one here to listen to you.

original: ma sems par 'dug cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: ma sems par 'dug cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Do not think about it. Stay here.”

original: sbyin pa chen pos de skad ces bsgo ba thos nas bsam pa bzhin du ma grub pas yi dam bcas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen pos de skad ces bsgo ba thos nas bsam pa bzhin du ma grub pas yi dam bcas te /
translated: When Mahāsattva heard this, he was not able to do as he wished. He made a vow:

original: bsam pa 'di ma grub kyi bar du pha ma'i mdun du sa la khas bub tu nyal te mi ldang ngo snyam bsams nas yab yum gyis mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di ma grub kyi bar du pha ma'i mdun du sa la khas bub tu nyal te mi ldang ngo snyam bsams nas yab yum gyis mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Until this thought is fulfilled, I will not get up but will lie on the ground in front of my parents.”

original: bdag ni / bsam pa bzhin du ma grub kyi bar du khas bub tu nyal ba 'di las mi ldang ngo //
analyzed: bdag ni / bsam pa bzhin du ma grub kyi bar du khas bub tu nyal ba 'di las mi ldang ngo //
translated: I will not rise from this prone position until my wish is fulfilled.

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: Thus he spoke.🔽

original: de nas pha ma mi dga' ste gnyen bshes dang bgros nas rgya mtsho'i nang du bgegs yang ba mang du yod pa'i gtam yang byas /
analyzed: de nas pha ma mi dga' ste gnyen bshes dang bgros nas rgya mtsho'i nang du bgegs yang ba mang du yod pa'i gtam yang byas /
translated: Then his parents, unhappy, consulted with their relatives and told him of the many dangers in the ocean.

original: bdag kyang rmongs pa las lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du lha kun la mchod de khyod lta zhig nga'i bur skyes na /
analyzed: bdag kyang rmongs pa las lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du lha kun la mchod de khyod lta zhig nga'i bur skyes na /
translated: “I, too, am confused. For twelve years I have made offerings to all the gods. If you were born as my son,🔽don’t abandon us and eat some food.”

original: nged ma dor bar zan zo zhig ces zhag gcig zhag gnyis nas zhag drug gi bar du tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gros btab kyang ma nyan te /
analyzed: nged ma dor bar zan zo zhig ces zhag gcig zhag gnyis nas zhag drug gi bar du tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gros btab kyang ma nyan te /
translated: For one day, two days, up to six days, they spoke with various words, but he did not listen.

original: sngar ji skad da smras pa las ma ldog go /
analyzed: sngar ji skad da smras pa las ma ldog go /
translated: He did not turn back from what he had said before.

original: pha ma skrag nas yang 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: pha ma skrag nas yang 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: His parents, frightened, said this:

original: bdag gi bu 'di thog ma nas da tsam gyi bar du bya ba brtsams pa mthar ma grub kyi bar du mi @366b gtong bas /
analyzed: bdag gi bu 'di thog ma nas da tsam gyi bar du bya ba brtsams pa mthar ma grub kyi bar du mi @366b gtong bas /
translated: “From the beginning until now, this son of ours has not completed any task he has begun.

original: rgya mtshor btang na brgya la phyir ldog kyang srid kyi /
analyzed: rgya mtshor btang na brgya la phyir ldog kyang srid kyi /
translated: If he were to go to sea, there is a chance he might return.

original: ma btang na zhag bdun lon na 'phral du bye brag 'bye ste /
analyzed: ma btang na zhag bdun lon na 'phral du bye brag 'bye ste /
translated: But if he does not go, after seven days he will die.

original: da ni / gtang dgos so snyam bgros nas bu'i drung du song ste lag pa nas bzung nas bu longs la zan zo zhig /
analyzed: da ni / gtang dgos so snyam bgros nas bu'i drung du song ste lag pa nas bzung nas bu longs la zan zo zhig /
translated: So they discussed it and went to their son. Holding his hand, they said, Son, get up and eat some food.

original: yid bzhin du 'gro bar gnang ngo //
analyzed: yid bzhin du 'gro bar gnang ngo //
translated: We give you permission to go wherever you wish.

original: zhes smras pa dang / sbyin pa chen po yang langs te bza' ba zos /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / sbyin pa chen po yang langs te bza' ba zos /
translated: The Great Giver got up and ate food.

original: btang ba 'thungs so //
analyzed: btang ba 'thungs so //
translated: He drank what was given to him.🔽Then he went outside and said to the many people,

original: de nas phyi rol tu byung ste mi mang po la kho bo rgya mtshor rin po che len du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol tu byung ste mi mang po la kho bo rgya mtshor rin po che len du 'gro'o //
translated: I am going to the ocean to get jewels.

original: khyed su 'gror dga' ba rnams dang 'grogs te 'dong gi /
analyzed: khyed su 'gror dga' ba rnams dang 'grogs te 'dong gi /
translated: Those of you who wish to go, come along.

original: de dad pon yang kho bos bya la yo byed kyang kho bos sbyar ro; ;zhes bsgrags so //
analyzed: de dad pon yang kho bos bya la yo byed kyang kho bos sbyar ro; ;zhes bsgrags so //
translated: I will be your leader and I will provide the necessities.

original: de'i tshe mi lnga brgya tsam yang 'gro bar khas blangs nas so so nas yo byad sbyar te nam 'gro ba'i dus kyang byas nas dus bzhin du lam du zhugs te chos so //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi lnga brgya tsam yang 'gro bar khas blangs nas so so nas yo byad sbyar te nam 'gro ba'i dus kyang byas nas dus bzhin du lam du zhugs te chos so //
translated: At that time, about five hundred people agreed to go. They prepared their own provisions and set a time to leave. When the time came, they set out on the road.

original: lam du 'jug pa'i tshe khye'u'i pha ma dang / rgyal po dang / rgyal bu dang / blon po la sogs te yul mi thams cad kyis kyang bskyal nas rdzongs bstabs so //
analyzed: lam du 'jug pa'i tshe khye'u'i pha ma dang / rgyal po dang / rgyal bu dang / blon po la sogs te yul mi thams cad kyis kyang bskyal nas rdzongs bstabs so //
translated: When they set out on the road, the boy's parents, the king, the prince, the ministers, and all the people of the country saw them off and gave them provisions.

original: pha mas kyang ngus te phyi phyag byas nas zhag du ma'i lam 'das pa dang / 'brog stong du phyin te nub mo dgong ma la du mi rgod kyis bcom nas nor rdzas kun 'phrog go /
analyzed: pha mas kyang ngus te phyi phyag byas nas zhag du ma'i lam 'das pa dang / 'brog stong du phyin te nub mo dgong ma la du mi rgod kyis bcom nas nor rdzas kun 'phrog go /
translated: The parents wept and bowed to them. After passing many days on the road, they reached a deserted wilderness. At night, bandits attacked them and stole all their possessions.

original: de nas song song ba la grong khyer shu pa ra zhes bya bar phyin nas grong khyer de na bram ze ka pi li zhes bya ba dang phrad de /
analyzed: de nas song song ba la grong khyer shu pa ra zhes bya bar phyin nas grong khyer de na bram ze ka pi li zhes bya ba dang phrad de /
translated: Then, as they continued on their way, they reached a city called Śubhapura. There they met a brahman called Kapila.

original: bram ze de'i khyim du song nas bram ze de las sbyin pa chen pos gser srang sum stong bslang bar byas so //
analyzed: bram ze de'i khyim du song nas bram ze de las sbyin pa chen pos gser srang sum stong bslang bar byas so //
translated: He went to the home of the brahman and asked for three thousand ounces of gold from the brahman.

original: @367a *// de'i tshe na bram ze de la bu mo gser gyi mdog can /
analyzed: @367a *// de'i tshe na bram ze de la bu mo gser gyi mdog can /
translated: At that time, the brahman had a daughter with a golden complexion,

original: skra mthon mthing khar 'dug pa /
analyzed: skra mthon mthing khar 'dug pa /
translated: her hair the color of deep blue,

original: rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed kyi rgyal bu thams cad kyis bslangs na yang ma ster ba zhig yod de /🔽de'i tshe na sbyin pa chen po bram ze de'i sgor song ste bram ze ka pi li 'dug gam zhes dris pa'i tshe bu mos khyim gyi nang nas sbyin pa chen po'i skad thos pa tsam gyis sgo phyi na skad grag pa 'di kho mo'i khyim thab yin
analyzed: rgyal phran brgyad khri bzhi stong snyed kyi rgyal bu thams cad kyis bslangs na yang ma ster ba zhig yod de / de'i tshe na sbyin pa chen po bram ze de'i sgor song ste bram ze ka pi li 'dug gam zhes dris pa'i tshe bu mos khyim gyi nang nas sbyin pa chen po'i skad thos pa tsam gyis sgo phyi na skad grag pa 'di kho mo'i khyim thab yin
translated: and although all the princes of eighty-four thousand minor kingdoms asked for her hand in marriage, he did not give her away.

original: no // zhes pha ma la smras so //🔽de nas bram ze sgor byung nas phrad pa dang / khye'u de la 'di ni /
analyzed: no // zhes pha ma la smras so // de nas bram ze sgor byung nas phrad pa dang / khye'u de la 'di ni /
translated: At that time, the Great Giver went to the door of the brahman's house and asked, Is the brahman Kapila at home? The moment the daughter heard the voice of the Great Giver from within the house, she said to her parents, The one who is shouting outside the door is my husband.

original: nges par gzhan bas 'phags so snyam bsams so //
analyzed: nges par gzhan bas 'phags so snyam bsams so //
translated: Then the brahman came out the door and met him, and the young man thought, This one is certainly superior to others.

original: khye'u des gser bslangs pa dang / bram zes kyang sbyin par gnang nas lag pa ya gcig tu ni /
analyzed: khye'u des gser bslangs pa dang / bram zes kyang sbyin par gnang nas lag pa ya gcig tu ni /
translated: The brahman agreed to give the gold, and the boy took the gold in one hand

original: gser thogs / lag pa ya gcig gis bu mo khrid de; bu mo 'di yang khyod kyi chung mar sbyin gyi /
analyzed: gser thogs / lag pa ya gcig gis bu mo khrid de; bu mo 'di yang khyod kyi chung mar sbyin gyi /
translated: and led the girl by the other hand, saying, “I give you this girl as your wife.🔽Take her!”

original: longs shig ces smras pa dang / sbyin pa chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: longs shig ces smras pa dang / sbyin pa chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahādatta said,

original: bdag ni / rgya mtsho chen por rin po che len du 'gro ste /
analyzed: bdag ni / rgya mtsho chen por rin po che len du 'gro ste /
translated: “I am going to the great ocean to get jewels.

original: rgya mtsho'i nang na bgegs shin tu mang bas kho bo 'khor tam mi 'khor gyi gtol med de /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i nang na bgegs shin tu mang bas kho bo 'khor tam mi 'khor gyi gtol med de /
translated: There are many obstacles in the ocean, and I do not know whether I will return or not.

original: khyod kyi bu mo chung mar len pa'i thugs mi thub bo //
analyzed: khyod kyi bu mo chung mar len pa'i thugs mi thub bo //
translated: I cannot take your daughter as my wife.”

original: bram zes smras pa /🔽khyod bde bar 'khor na bu mo 'di chung mar longs shig ces smras pa dang / sbyin pa chen pos kyang phyir 'khor na de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: bram zes smras pa / khyod bde bar 'khor na bu mo 'di chung mar longs shig ces smras pa dang / sbyin pa chen pos kyang phyir 'khor na de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The brahman said,🔽“If you return safely, take this girl as your wife.”

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: Mahādatta said, “If I return, I will do as you say.”

original: de nas bram zes kyang gser srang sum @367b stong dang / gzhan yang yo byad ci dgos pa kun sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas bram zes kyang gser srang sum @367b stong dang / gzhan yang yo byad ci dgos pa kun sbyar te /
translated: Then the brahman also provided three thousand ounces of gold and all the other necessary provisions.

original: de nas chas pas rgya mtsho'i ngogs su phyin to //
analyzed: de nas chas pas rgya mtsho'i ngogs su phyin to //
translated: Then they set out and reached the shore of the ocean.

original: de nas gru bcos te gru'i nang du zhugs nas de nas thag pa bdun gyis brtod de gru'i nang nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas gru bcos te gru'i nang du zhugs nas de nas thag pa bdun gyis brtod de gru'i nang nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then they prepared the ship and boarded it. They tied it with seven ropes and from inside the ship they said this:

original: rgya mtsho'i nang na bgegs 'di dag yod de /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i nang na bgegs 'di dag yod de /
translated: “There are these obstacles in the ocean:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: rlung nag po dang / srin po dang / chu'i dba' rlabs 'khyil pa dang / klu gdug pa dang / chu'i mdog lta bu'i ri dang / chu srin la sogs pa'i bgegs yang ba mang du yod kyi /
analyzed: rlung nag po dang / srin po dang / chu'i dba' rlabs 'khyil pa dang / klu gdug pa dang / chu'i mdog lta bu'i ri dang / chu srin la sogs pa'i bgegs yang ba mang du yod kyi /
translated: black winds, rākṣasas, swirling waves, poisonous nāgas, mountains the color of water, and many other light obstacles such as sea monsters.

original: khyed las 'gror mi dad pa zhig yod na 'di las phyir log cig //
analyzed: khyed las 'gror mi dad pa zhig yod na 'di las phyir log cig //
translated: If any of you are not willing to go, turn back from here.

original: phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re /
analyzed: phyis 'gyod par gyur ta re /
translated: Later you will regret it.

original: gal te lus dang srog la mi lta ste /
analyzed: gal te lus dang srog la mi lta ste /
translated: If you do not care about your body and life,

original: pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / gnyen bshes la mi chags na 'dong ngo //
analyzed: pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / gnyen bshes la mi chags na 'dong ngo //
translated: If you do not have attachment to father, mother, brothers, sons, wives, and relatives, then you may go.

original: gal te bde bar phyin na /
analyzed: gal te bde bar phyin na /
translated: If you arrive safely,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis bu tsha rabs bdun tshun chad phyug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis bu tsha rabs bdun tshun chad phyug par 'gyur te /
translated: the seven precious substances will make your descendants rich for seven generations.

original: longs spyod zad mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod zad mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Your enjoyments will be inexhaustible.

original: zhes smras nas thag pa gcig bcad do //
analyzed: zhes smras nas thag pa gcig bcad do //
translated: Having said this, he cut one of the ropes.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma bdun gyi bar du nyin re lan re de skad sgras nas rtod thag re re bcad de rlung dang sbyar te g-yor shing bsgreng bas mgyogs khyod mda' bzhin song ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma bdun gyi bar du nyin re lan re de skad sgras nas rtod thag re re bcad de rlung dang sbyar te g-yor shing bsgreng bas mgyogs khyod mda' bzhin song ngo //
translated: In the same way, for seven days he called out each day, cut one of the ropes, and applied the wind. The ship was raised and went quickly like an arrow.

original: de nas tshong ba dag dang rin po che'i gling du phyin nas sbyin pa chen po mang du thos pas rin po che brtag pa la yang shin tu mkhas te /
analyzed: de nas tshong ba dag dang rin po che'i gling du phyin nas sbyin pa chen po mang du thos pas rin po che brtag pa la yang shin tu mkhas te /
translated: Then the merchants arrived at the island of jewels. Because Mahāsattva had heard much, he was also very skilled in evaluating jewels.

original: rin po che bzang ngan dang / lci yang dang / ji tsam ri ba'i rin thang @368a *//
analyzed: rin po che bzang ngan dang / lci yang dang / ji tsam ri ba'i rin thang @368a *//
translated: He knew the good and bad qualities of the jewels, their weight, and their value.

original: phan tshun tshong pa rnams la bstan nas rin po che kha ngog 'di lta bu ni /🔽yang mod kyi /🔽rin che'o // rin po che 'di dag ni /
analyzed: phan tshun tshong pa rnams la bstan nas rin po che kha ngog 'di lta bu ni / yang mod kyi / rin che'o // rin po che 'di dag ni /
translated: He showed it to the merchants and said,🔽“This is a precious gem.

original: lci yang rin chung gi /
analyzed: lci yang rin chung gi /
translated: These gems are cheap.

original: ma len cig /🔽ha cang yang mang ches na gru lci bas 'bying ngo //
analyzed: ma len cig / ha cang yang mang ches na gru lci bas 'bying ngo //
translated: Don’t take them.🔽If you take too many, the ship will sink because of the weight.

original: ha cang nyung ches na yang nyon mongs te song song ba'i don med pas /
analyzed: ha cang nyung ches na yang nyon mongs te song song ba'i don med pas /
translated: If you take too few, you will be disappointed.

original: 'di tsam zhig ni /
analyzed: 'di tsam zhig ni /
translated: This much is just right.”

original: ran no // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshod kyang bstan nas rin po che grur brdzangs te ci la yang ma rag nas da phyir 'dong ngo //🔽zhes chas pa dang / sbyin pa chen po gru'i nang du 'ong du ma btub nas tshong pa rnams la kho bo ni /
analyzed: ran no // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshod kyang bstan nas rin po che grur brdzangs te ci la yang ma rag nas da phyir 'dong ngo // zhes chas pa dang / sbyin pa chen po gru'i nang du 'ong du ma btub nas tshong pa rnams la kho bo ni /
translated: He loaded the ship with gems. He did not get anything else. He said, “Now let’s go back.”

original: klu'i rgyal po'i pho brang nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ma thob kyi bar du mi ldog go /🔽zhes smras so //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po'i pho brang nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ma thob kyi bar du mi ldog go /🔽zhes smras so //
translated: Mahādatta was not allowed to board the ship. He said to the merchants, “I will not return from the palace of the nāga king until I get the wish-fulfilling jewel.”

original: de nas tshong pa rnams kyis dus te mya ngan gyis yi mug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshong pa rnams kyis dus te mya ngan gyis yi mug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the merchants, in despair, lamented, saying:

original: bdag cag tshong pa 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: bdag cag tshong pa 'di rnams ni /
translated: “We merchants

original: skyes bu ded dpon khyod kyi g-yog tu 'ongs te /
analyzed: skyes bu ded dpon khyod kyi g-yog tu 'ongs te /
translated: have come to be the followers of the leader.

original: da khyod kyis 'dir dor to mi 'gro na bdag cag kyang phyir khyim du mi phyin te /
analyzed: da khyod kyis 'dir dor to mi 'gro na bdag cag kyang phyir khyim du mi phyin te /
translated: If you are not going to take us with you, we will not return home.

original: thams cad 'khyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'khyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will all be lost.”

original: sbyin pa chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen pos smras pa /
translated: Mahādatta said:

original: tshong pa khyed cag mi nyes par yul du phyin par kho bos kyang smon lam gdab bo //
analyzed: tshong pa khyed cag mi nyes par yul du phyin par kho bos kyang smon lam gdab bo //
translated: “Merchants, I will pray that you will return to your country without harm.”

original: zhes bog por lag tu blangs te phyogs bzhir mchod nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: zhes bog por lag tu blangs te phyogs bzhir mchod nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He took a torch in his hand, made offerings in the four directions, and said:

original: bdag ni / rin po che blangs te sems can phongs pa la spyin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / rin po che blangs te sems can phongs pa la spyin par ma zad kyi /
translated: “I have not only taken jewels and given them to the poor.

original: de ltar sbyin pa byed @368b pa'i bsod nams des sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa byed @368b pa'i bsod nams des sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I have given in order to attain buddhahood.

original: bdag gis smras pa 'di bden te smon lam bzhin du 'grub na /
analyzed: bdag gis smras pa 'di bden te smon lam bzhin du 'grub na /
translated: If what I have said is true and my prayer is fulfilled,

original: tshong pa 'di dag rin po che dang bcas pa nye zhe med par 'dzam bu'i gling du bde bar phyin par shog cig ces smon lam btab nas thag pa bcad de g-yor shing bsgrengs nas phyir 'dzam bu'i gling du bde bar dong ngo //
analyzed: tshong pa 'di dag rin po che dang bcas pa nye zhe med par 'dzam bu'i gling du bde bar phyin par shog cig ces smon lam btab nas thag pa bcad de g-yor shing bsgrengs nas phyir 'dzam bu'i gling du bde bar dong ngo //
translated: May these merchants, together with their jewels, return safely to Jambudvipa! Having made this prayer, he cut the rope, raised the sail, and they returned safely to Jambudvipa.

original: de dag song ba'i 'og tu sbyin pa chen po chur zhugs te song ba las zhag bdun gyi bar du ni /
analyzed: de dag song ba'i 'og tu sbyin pa chen po chur zhugs te song ba las zhag bdun gyi bar du ni /
translated: After they had left, Mahadatta entered the water and went on. For seven days

original: pus mo tsam las ma nub bo //
analyzed: pus mo tsam las ma nub bo //
translated: he was able to go only up to his knees.

original: de nas yang zhag bdun gyi bar du ni /
analyzed: de nas yang zhag bdun gyi bar du ni /
translated: Then for seven days

original: brla drung tsam las ma nub bo /
analyzed: brla drung tsam las ma nub bo /
translated: he was able to go only up to his thighs.

original: ;de nas yang zhag bdun song ba las rked pa tsam las ma nub bo //
analyzed: ;de nas yang zhag bdun song ba las rked pa tsam las ma nub bo //
translated: Then for seven days he was able to go only up to his waist.

original: zhag bdun lon gyi bar du ni /
analyzed: zhag bdun lon gyi bar du ni /
translated: For seven days

original: phrag pa tsam du phyin to //
analyzed: phrag pa tsam du phyin to //
translated: he was able to go only up to his shoulders.

translated: The Great Giver said, I will do as you say.

analyzed: de nas klu'i rgyal pos zla ba gnyis kyi bar du kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs sbyar te phul nas rol mo sna tshogs kyis mchod de byang chub sems dpas kyang de dag la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi'i chos kyi rnam grangs
translated: Then the naga king prepared various kinds of food with a hundred flavors and offered it for two months. He made offerings with various kinds of music. The bodhisattva taught them the Dharma discourse on the four bases of miraculous power.

analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du bstan te phyir 'gro bar bsams nas klu'i rgyal pos kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bkrol te phul nas skyes bu chen po yi dam la shin tu brtan pa khyod gdon mi za bar 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: For two months he taught it. Thinking to leave, the naga king took off his wish-fulfilling jewel and offered it. He said, Great being, you are very firm in your commitments. You will certainly attain buddhahood.

analyzed: nam mngon par sangs rgyas pa na bdag kyang khyod kyi nye gnas bgyi'o //

analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / de bzhin du gyur cig ces smras so //

analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di la mthu stobs ci yod ces dris na /

analyzed: nor bu 'di ni / dpag tshad bzhi stong kho ra khor yug tu ci 'dod pa thams cad char bzhin du 'bebs so //
translated: This jewel

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: can rain down whatever is desired for a distance of four thousand leagues in every direction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'di snyam du rin po che 'di mthu stobs che mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'di snyam du rin po che 'di mthu stobs che mod kyi /

analyzed: snyam nas klu'i rgyal pos mkhar gyi sgo'i phyi rol tu byang chub sems @372a *// dpa' bskyal to //
translated: The nāga king escorted the bodhisattva outside the palace gate.

original: de nas yang song song ba las rgyang ma nas gser gyi mkhar rab tu 'tsher ba zhig mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i drung du song nas phyin pa dang / mkhar de yang 'obs rim pa bdun gyis bskor te /
analyzed: de nas yang song song ba las rgyang ma nas gser gyi mkhar rab tu 'tsher ba zhig mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i drung du song nas phyin pa dang / mkhar de yang 'obs rim pa bdun gyis bskor te /
translated: Then, as he continued on his way, he saw a golden palace shining in the distance. When the bodhisattva approached it, he saw that the palace was surrounded by seven moats

analyzed: 'obs kyi nang na sbrul gdug pas yongs su gang ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang byams pa'i sems bskyed pas sbrul gyi gdug pa zhi nas de la brdzis te song ngo //

analyzed: mkhar de la'ang klu gnyis shig 'khyil te mgo sgo'i phyi rol tu bstan nas nyal ba /

original: mkhar de'i nang na klu'i rgyal pos rin po che'i gzhal med khang nas byang chub sems dpa' rgyang ma nas mthong ste 'di snyam du bdag gi gnas 'di ni; 'obs rim pa bdun gyis bskor te /

analyzed: de nas kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs sbyar te phul nas kha zas zos pa'i 'og tu khyod su zhig /

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas bdag ni; 'dzam bu'i gling nas mchis te /

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dag bsod nams chung bas /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dag bsod nams chung bas /

original: nor dang zas dang skom gyi phyir gcig la gcig rnam pa sna tshogs pas 'tsho zhing gsod de /
analyzed: nor dang zas dang skom gyi phyir gcig la gcig rnam pa sna tshogs pas 'tsho zhing gsod de /
translated: For the sake of wealth, food, and drink, they kill each other in various ways and make their living by killing each other.

analyzed: klu'i rgyal pos smras pa / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ni /
translated: The nāga king said,

analyzed: rnyed par sla ba ma yin te /

analyzed: skyes bu khyod bdag la re ste 'ongs na /
translated: Since you have come to me with hope,

analyzed: bdag gi gnas 'dir zla ba bzhi zhig 'dug ste bdag cag gi mchod pa bzhes na /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che yang dbul lo // zhes byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpas kyang de bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: Then I will give you the precious jewel.”

original: zhes smras nas /
analyzed: zhes smras nas /
translated: The bodhisattva said, “I will do just that.”

original: klu'i rgyal pos zla ba bzhi'i bar du kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs sbyar te phul nas rol mo mang pos kyang mchod do //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal pos zla ba bzhi'i bar du kha zas ro brgya dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs sbyar te phul nas rol mo mang pos kyang mchod do //

original: de la byang chub sems dpas chos kyi rnam grangs rgya cher phye zhing bstan pas klu'i rgyal po rab tu dga' ste klu @373a *//
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas chos kyi rnam grangs rgya cher phye zhing bstan pas klu'i rgyal po rab tu dga' ste klu @373a *//
translated: The bodhisattva taught the Dharma extensively to the nāga king, and the nāga king was very pleased.

analyzed: gzhan dang / gnod sbyin gzhan la mi ltos par yo byad thams cad kyang yid bzhin du sbyar to //
translated: Without relying on other nāgas or other yakṣas, he provided all the necessities just as [the bodhisattva] wished.

translated: After four months of such behavior, when the bodhisattva was about to leave, the nāga king took off the wish-fulfilling jewel from his crest and offered it to the bodhisattva, saying, “Great being, you are steadfast in your commitments. You will certainly attain buddhahood.”

analyzed: nam mngon par sangs rgyas pa na bdag kyang nye gnas mchog tu gyur te bsnyen bkur byed par shog cig ces smon lam btab bo //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang de bzhin du gyur cig ces smras nas nor bu rin po che 'di la mthu stobs ji tsam zhig yod ces dris so //

original: klu'i rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal pos smras pa /

analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di ni; dpag tshad brgyad stong khor khor yug tu rin po che char bzhin du 'bebs te /
translated: “This precious jewel rains down jewels all around for eight thousand leagues.

analyzed: ci 'dod pa thams cad 'bebs so // zhes smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gdod dga' nas 'di snyam du 'dzam bu gling gi sa khyon ni /

analyzed: dpag tshad bdun stong las med de /

original: nor bu rin po che 'dis ni /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'dis ni /
translated: This precious jewel

translated: The nāga king and his retinue escorted him and then returned home.

analyzed: byang chub @373b sems dpas pha zad cig tu phyin nas nor bu rin po che rnams lag tu thogs nas 'di skad ces smon lam btab bo //

analyzed: nor bu 'di yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yin yang dag na; bdag nam mkha' la 'phur bar gyur cig ces smras so //

analyzed: de skad ces smras ma thag tu nam mkha' la 'phur te rgya mtsho'i bgegs las thar nas rgya mtsho'i ngogs su phyin par gyur te /
translated: As soon as he said this, he flew up into the sky, escaped from the ocean’s obstacles, and reached the shore of the ocean.

translated: There, he lay down to rest and fell asleep. At that time, the minor nāgas of the ocean discussed this:🔽“This man has taken away our precious jewels.

analyzed: rgya mtsho 'di na nor bu rin po che 'di gsum las med de /
translated: “In this ocean there are only these three precious jewels.

analyzed: gsum char mi 'dis khyer gyi /
translated: This man has taken all three.

original: nor bu 'di ni /
analyzed: nor bu 'di ni /
translated: This jewel

analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pas bdag cag la yang dgos kyi phyir brku'o //
translated: is necessary for us because it has good qualities. Let’s steal it back.”

analyzed: zhes bgros nas byang chub sems dpa' gnyid kyis log pa'i tshe yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che klu rnams kyis phyir brkus so //
translated: After they had discussed this, when the Bodhisattva was asleep, the nāgas stole back the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sad nas bltas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sad nas bltas na /

original: nor bu rin po che med pas 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che med pas 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: Since the precious jewel was not there, he thought,

original: 'ad ni / gdon mi za bar rgya mtsho'i klus brkus kyi /
analyzed: 'ad ni / gdon mi za bar rgya mtsho'i klus brkus kyi /
translated: “Without a doubt the nāgas of the ocean stole it.🔽I will dry up the ocean water with whatever power I have.”

analyzed: bdag gis mthu ci yod pas rgya mtsho'i chu bcus te bskam par bya'o snyam bsams te nor bu phyir ma thob kyi bar du lag pa stong par phyir mi 'gro'o snyam yi dam bcas nas rgya mtsho'i ngogs su song ste rus sbal gyi khog pa zhig blangs nas
translated: He made a vow that he would not return home empty-handed until he had recovered the jewel. He went to the ocean shore and took the shell of a turtle.

analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis rgya mtsho'i chu bcus @374a *//

analyzed: so; ;de'i tshe na rgya mtsho'i lhas de'i bsam pa shes nas de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and at that time the ocean god, knowing his thoughts, said to him,

original: rgya mtsho 'di ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho 'di ni /
translated: “This ocean

analyzed: gting zab cing yangs te /
translated: is deep and vast,

analyzed: dpag tshad stong phrag sum brgya sum cu yod pa /

analyzed: gal te 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad log kyang rgya mtsho skam par byed mi nus na /

analyzed: khyod gcig pus nus pa lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone you alone.

original: don med do //
analyzed: don med do //
translated: It is pointless.”

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva said,

original: mi gcig gi snying nas las byas na /
analyzed: mi gcig gi snying nas las byas na /
translated: “If one does an action with a sincere heart,

original: ci yang mi 'grub pa med de /
analyzed: ci yang mi 'grub pa med de /
translated: there is nothing that will not be accomplished.

original: bdag gi rin po che rnyed pa des 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba bya bar bsams te /
analyzed: bdag gi rin po che rnyed pa des 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba bya bar bsams te /

analyzed: de'i bsod nams kyis mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: and by its merit I will attain full enlightenment.

original: de la sems ma zhum na /
analyzed: de la sems ma zhum na /
translated: If my mind does not become discouraged,

analyzed: ci'i phyir rgya mtsho 'di skam par mi nus zhes smras so //

analyzed: de'i tshe na lha khyab 'jug la sogs pas rgyang ma nas byang chub sems dpa' gcig pu lus yid mthun par rgya mtsho'i chu bcus te 'gro ba mang pos don du dka' ba byed pa mthong nas de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' la bstang ngo snyam bsams
translated: At that time, from a distance, the gods such as Viṣṇu saw the Bodhisattva alone, his body and mind in harmony, drawing up the water of the ocean, performing austerities for the sake of many beings. Thinking, We too should serve the Bodhisattva,

original: lan gsum smyugs pas dpag tshad brgya nyi shu bri nas klu de dag 'jigs skrag ste /
analyzed: lan gsum smyugs pas dpag tshad brgya nyi shu bri nas klu de dag 'jigs skrag ste /
translated: Drawing it up a third time, they drew one hundred and twenty leagues. The nāgas became frightened🔽and said, If this continues, the ocean will dry up.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du lhags nas 'di skad du thong zhig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du lhags nas 'di skad du thong zhig /
translated: The nāgas came to the bodhisattva and said, Please stop!

original: rgya mtsho'i chu skam par ma byed cig ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpas btang ngo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu skam par ma byed cig ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpas btang ngo //
translated: Do not dry up the ocean water! The bodhisattva released it.

original: de nas klu rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' la khyod kyi nor bu rin po che 'di ci zhig tu dgos /
analyzed: de nas klu rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' la khyod kyi nor bu rin po che 'di ci zhig tu dgos /
translated: Then the nāgas said to the bodhisattva, What do you want with this jewel?

original: smras pa / sems can la phan pa'i don du dgos so //🔽glus smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / sems can la phan pa'i don du dgos so // glus smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva replied, I want it for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sems can la phan pa'i don du dgos na /
analyzed: sems can la phan pa'i don du dgos na /
translated: The nāgas said, If it is for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: rgya mtsho'i nang na yang sems can mang du yod na /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i nang na yang sems can mang du yod na /
translated: there are many sentient beings in the ocean,

original: ci'i phyir bskur zhes smras so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bskur zhes smras so //
translated: so why do you want it?

original: smras pa / rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas pa yang sems can yin mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas pa yang sems can yin mod kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva replied, The sentient beings who live in the ocean are sentient beings, it is true,

original: de la phongs pa'i sdug bsngal med do; ;'dzam bu gling gi sems can dag ni /
analyzed: de la phongs pa'i sdug bsngal med do; ;'dzam bu gling gi sems can dag ni /
translated: but they do not suffer from poverty. The sentient beings of Jambudvīpa

original: nor gyi phyir gcig gis gcig la rnam par 'tshe zhing gnod pa byed de /
analyzed: nor gyi phyir gcig gis gcig la rnam par 'tshe zhing gnod pa byed de /
translated: harm and injure each other for the sake of wealth.

original: mi dge ba bcu rdzogs par byed pas tshe 'phos nas kun sems can dmyal bar skye ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu rdzogs par byed pas tshe 'phos nas kun sems can dmyal bar skye ste /
translated: Having completed the ten nonvirtues, they will be reborn in the hells after death.

original: bdag ni / de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir rin po che 'di dgos so //🔽zhes smras pa dang / klu rnams kyis nor bu rin po che phyung ste slar phul lo; ;rgya mtsho'i lhas byang chub sems dpa' do ltar brtson 'grus la brtan pa mthong nas 'di ni /
analyzed: bdag ni / de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir rin po che 'di dgos so // zhes smras pa dang / klu rnams kyis nor bu rin po che phyung ste slar phul lo; ;rgya mtsho'i lhas byang chub sems dpa' do ltar brtson 'grus la brtan pa mthong nas 'di ni /
translated: I need these jewels out of compassion for them.”

original: gdon mi za bar 'tshang rgya'o snyam sems te /🔽nam mngon par sangs rgyas @375a *//
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'tshang rgya'o snyam sems te / nam mngon par sangs rgyas @375a *//
translated: The nāgas took out the jewels and returned them. The ocean deity, seeing the bodhisattva’s steadfast perseverance in this way, thought, “He will surely become a buddha.

original: pa na bdag kyang nye gnas kyi mchog tu gyur cig ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: pa na bdag kyang nye gnas kyi mchog tu gyur cig ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: When he attains manifest enlightenment, may I become his foremost disciple.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas rin po che phyir thob nas steng gi nam mkha' la 'phur te gnas su 'ongs nas sngar gyi tshong pa grogs po rnams yod dam /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas rin po che phyir thob nas steng gi nam mkha' la 'phur te gnas su 'ongs nas sngar gyi tshong pa grogs po rnams yod dam /
translated: Then the bodhisattva, having recovered the jewels, flew up into the sky and returned to his home. He asked, “Are my former merchant companions still here?

original: bde bar phyin tam zhes dris so //
analyzed: bde bar phyin tam zhes dris so //
translated: Have they arrived safely?”

original: tshong pa grogs po dag bde bar phyin nas de dag gcig la gcig dga' nas grogs po rnams kyis ngo mtshar ya mtshan du bzung ngo //
analyzed: tshong pa grogs po dag bde bar phyin nas de dag gcig la gcig dga' nas grogs po rnams kyis ngo mtshar ya mtshan du bzung ngo //
translated: The merchants, having arrived safely, were delighted and amazed at each other.

original: de nas bram ze ka pi li'i sgor song nas byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho nas phyir log go /
analyzed: de nas bram ze ka pi li'i sgor song nas byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho nas phyir log go /
translated: Then, having gone to the door of the brahmin Kapila, they announced, The Bodhisattva has returned from the ocean.

original: zhes thos nas thams cad kyis sgor bsu ste rab tu dga' nas tshong ba grogs po rnams dang bcas pa la dga' ston chen po byas so //
analyzed: zhes thos nas thams cad kyis sgor bsu ste rab tu dga' nas tshong ba grogs po rnams dang bcas pa la dga' ston chen po byas so //
translated: Hearing this, everyone went to the door to welcome him. They were overjoyed and held a great celebration for the merchants and their friends.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpas rin po che thogs te khyim du 'ongs pa dang / bram ze de'i bang mdzod thams cad yongs su gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpas rin po che thogs te khyim du 'ongs pa dang / bram ze de'i bang mdzod thams cad yongs su gang bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, when the Bodhisattva entered the house carrying the jewels, all the brahmin's treasuries became completely filled.

original: de nas bram ze ka pi lis rin po che sna tshogs kyis bu mo brgyan nas rin po che'i chu snod bskur te byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang rkang lag bkrus nas bu mo'i lag pa nas bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' la gtad; byang chub sems dpas
analyzed: de nas bram ze ka pi lis rin po che sna tshogs kyis bu mo brgyan nas rin po che'i chu snod bskur te byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang rkang lag bkrus nas bu mo'i lag pa nas bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' la gtad; byang chub sems dpas
translated: Then the brahman Kapila adorned the girl with various jewels, gave her a jeweled water pot, and had her wash the Bodhisattva's body and limbs. Then he took the girl's hand and gave her to the Bodhisattva.

original: kyang bzhes nas bram ze rab tu dga' ste bu mo'i g-yog tu bu mo lnga brgya dang / glang po che lnga brgya yang rin po ches brgyan te rol mo @375b byas nas byang chub sems dpa' la brdzangs so //
analyzed: kyang bzhes nas bram ze rab tu dga' ste bu mo'i g-yog tu bu mo lnga brgya dang / glang po che lnga brgya yang rin po ches brgyan te rol mo @375b byas nas byang chub sems dpa' la brdzangs so //
translated: The Bodhisattva accepted her, and the brahman was overjoyed. He sent along five hundred girls as attendants for the girl, and five hundred elephants adorned with jewels, and they played music as they sent the Bodhisattva on his way.

original: de'i tshe na sbyin pa chen po'i pha ma bu dang dral ba'i 'og tu rtag tu dus pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na sbyin pa chen po'i pha ma bu dang dral ba'i 'og tu rtag tu dus pas /
translated: At that time, because of the separation from their son, the parents of the Great Giver were always grieving.

original: pha ma gnyis ka'i mig ldongs par gyur te /
analyzed: pha ma gnyis ka'i mig ldongs par gyur te /
translated: The eyes of both parents became blind.

original: bu rgya mtsho nas log pa dang pha ma phrad nas bus pha ma la phyag 'tshal te lag pa nas 'jus te bu yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: bu rgya mtsho nas log pa dang pha ma phrad nas bus pha ma la phyag 'tshal te lag pa nas 'jus te bu yin par rtogs so //
translated: When the son returned from the ocean, the parents met and the son bowed to them. He took their hands and they recognized him as their son.

original: sbyin pa chen po /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po /
translated: The Great Giver

original: khyod kyis nged por te song ba'i 'og tu mig kyang ldongs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis nged por te song ba'i 'og tu mig kyang ldongs so //
translated: “You have gone to the ocean and returned, but your eyes are blind.”🔽“What did you find by going to the ocean?”

original: khyod rgya mtshor song song nas ci rnyed ces dris pa dang / sbyin pa chen pos nor bu rin po che pa'i lag tu byin te /
analyzed: khyod rgya mtshor song song nas ci rnyed ces dris pa dang / sbyin pa chen pos nor bu rin po che pa'i lag tu byin te /
translated: Mahādāna took the precious jewel and placed it in his father’s hand.

original: bdag gis 'di rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di rnyed do //
translated: “I found this.”

original: zhes smras nas phas lag tu blangs te bsnams nas 'di lta bu'i rdo ba ni /
analyzed: zhes smras nas phas lag tu blangs te bsnams nas 'di lta bu'i rdo ba ni /
translated: His father took it in his hand and smelled it. “A stone like this

original: nga'i mdzod na sngon yang mang du yod na /
analyzed: nga'i mdzod na sngon yang mang du yod na /
translated: was in my treasury before.🔽What is the use of getting something like this?”

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang bsdo ci dgos zhes smras so; ;de nas byang chub sems dpas nor bu phyir blangs te pha ma'i mig phyis pa tsam gyis ji ltar rlung drag pos sprin bus pa bzhin du pha ma gnyis kyi mig kyang sngar bas gsal bar mthong🔽bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang bsdo ci dgos zhes smras so; ;de nas byang chub sems dpas nor bu phyir blangs te pha ma'i mig phyis pa tsam gyis ji ltar rlung drag pos sprin bus pa bzhin du pha ma gnyis kyi mig kyang sngar bas gsal bar mthong bar gyur to //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva took back the jewel and rubbed his parents’ eyes. As if a strong wind had blown away the clouds, his parents’ eyes became clearer than before.

original: de nas pha ma gnyis dga' ste /
analyzed: de nas pha ma gnyis dga' ste /
translated: Then his parents were delighted.

original: 'di ni / nor bu rin po che yin yang dag pa lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / nor bu rin po che yin yang dag pa lta ste /
translated: “This is a precious jewel. It is true.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i don yod par gyur to zhes smras so; ;de nas yang sbyin pa chen pos rin po che thogs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i don yod par gyur to zhes smras so; ;de nas yang sbyin pa chen pos rin po che thogs te /
translated: The merchant said, The meaning of the afflictions has been fulfilled.

original: khyod yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yin yang dag na /
analyzed: khyod yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yin yang dag na /
translated: Then the Great Giver took the jewel and said, If you are the wish-fulfilling jewel,

original: kho bo'i pha ma'i 'og tu rin po che sna bdun gyi gdan 'byung @376a *//
analyzed: kho bo'i pha ma'i 'og tu rin po che sna bdun gyi gdan 'byung @376a *//
translated: then may a seat of the seven precious substances appear beneath my parents,

original: zhing / rin po che'i bla res steng khebs par shog cig ces smon lam btab ma thag tu de bzhin du grub nas rgyal po'i bang mdzod thams cad kyang gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: zhing / rin po che'i bla res steng khebs par shog cig ces smon lam btab ma thag tu de bzhin du grub nas rgyal po'i bang mdzod thams cad kyang gang bar gyur to //
translated: and may a jeweled canopy cover above them. As soon as he made this aspiration, it was fulfilled, and the king's treasury was filled.

original: de nas rgyal pos pho nya zhig glang po che dpag tshad brgya stong du 'gro ba zhig la bskyon te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos pho nya zhig glang po che dpag tshad brgya stong du 'gro ba zhig la bskyon te /
translated: Then the king sent a messenger on an elephant that could travel a hundred thousand leagues,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad la sbyin pa chen pos rgya mtsho nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rnyed de /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad la sbyin pa chen pos rgya mtsho nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rnyed de /
translated: to all the people of Jambudvipa, saying, The Great Giver has found the wish-fulfilling jewel in the ocean.

original: nor bu yon tan can des da ste zhag bdun na rin po che la sogs pa gos dang / zas dang / dgos pa'i yon tan thams cad char bzhin du 'bebs kyi /
analyzed: nor bu yon tan can des da ste zhag bdun na rin po che la sogs pa gos dang / zas dang / dgos pa'i yon tan thams cad char bzhin du 'bebs kyi /
translated: The precious jewel with its excellent qualities proclaimed, From now on, in seven days, it will rain down jewels and so forth, clothes, food, and all the excellent qualities that are needed.

original: so so nas ci bder longs shig ces bsgrags so //🔽de ltar kun du bsgrags nas sbyin pa chen po khrus byas te gos gsar pa bgos nas ga la'i thung bu mnyam por rgyal mtshan btsugs te yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags nas bog phor lag tu blangs nas 'di
analyzed: so so nas ci bder longs shig ces bsgrags so // de ltar kun du bsgrags nas sbyin pa chen po khrus byas te gos gsar pa bgos nas ga la'i thung bu mnyam por rgyal mtshan btsugs te yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo la btags nas bog phor lag tu blangs nas 'di
translated: Each of you, take what you need!

original: skad ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: skad ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: After this proclamation, the Great Giver bathed and put on new clothes. He raised a banner with a flag on top of it, and attached the precious wish-fulfilling jewel to the top of the flag. He took a bowl in his hand and made this aspiration:

original: 'dzam bu gling gi mi dag ni /
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling gi mi dag ni /
translated: The people of the world

original: dbul phongs pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: dbul phongs pa sha stag ste /
translated: are all poor and destitute.

original: de dag la phan gdags dgos kyi /
analyzed: de dag la phan gdags dgos kyi /
translated: I must help them.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yin te mi rdzun na /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yin te mi rdzun na /
translated: If this is the precious wish-fulfilling jewel and not a lie,

original: so so nas ci dang ci dgos pa de dang de dag thams cad yid bzhin du char ltar phob cig ces smras ma thag tu phyogs bzhi nas rlung nag po g-yos nas de ma thag tu mi @376b gtsang ba'i nyal nyil thams cad phyags te char zim bu
analyzed: so so nas ci dang ci dgos pa de dang de dag thams cad yid bzhin du char ltar phob cig ces smras ma thag tu phyogs bzhi nas rlung nag po g-yos nas de ma thag tu mi @376b gtsang ba'i nyal nyil thams cad phyags te char zim bu
translated: As soon as they had spoken, a black wind arose from the four directions and immediately swept away all the filth. A gentle rain fell,

original: mi drag pa zhig bab nas rdul mi 'thul bar byas pa'i 'og tu thog mar bza' ba dang / btung ba ro brgya dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs char bzhin du bab bo //
analyzed: mi drag pa zhig bab nas rdul mi 'thul bar byas pa'i 'og tu thog mar bza' ba dang / btung ba ro brgya dang ldan pa rnam pa sna tshogs char bzhin du bab bo //
translated: not too heavy, and the dust was settled. After that, first of all, food and drink with a hundred flavors fell like rain, various kinds.

original: de nas 'bru rnams char bzhin du bab bo //
analyzed: de nas 'bru rnams char bzhin du bab bo //
translated: Then the grains fell like rain.

original: de nas gos char bzhin du bab bo //
analyzed: de nas gos char bzhin du bab bo //
translated: Then the clothes fell like rain.

original: de nas rin po che char bzhin du bab ste /🔽'dzam bu'i gling ni /
analyzed: de nas rin po che char bzhin du bab ste / 'dzam bu'i gling ni /
translated: Then the jewels fell like rain.🔽The world was filled with heaps of jewels. The jewels were piled up like

original: rin po che'i phung pos yongs su gang nas rin po che dag sog ma'am /
analyzed: rin po che'i phung pos yongs su gang nas rin po che dag sog ma'am /
translated: straw or🔽hay.

original: gyo mo lta bur byas te byang chub sems dpas de ltar kun chog par byas nas 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la 'di skad zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: gyo mo lta bur byas te byang chub sems dpas de ltar kun chog par byas nas 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la 'di skad zhes bsgo'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva, having thus made everything ready, addressed the people of Jambudvipa:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dag ni /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dag ni /
translated: The sentient beings of Jambudvipa

original: gos dang / zas dang / nor gyi phyir gcig la gcig gsod cing rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'ba' zhig byed de /
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / nor gyi phyir gcig la gcig gsod cing rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos 'ba' zhig byed de /
translated: kill each other for the sake of clothes, food, and wealth. They are tormented in various ways and only commit sinful and non-virtuous actions.

original: tshe'i dus byas nas ngan song gsum du lhung ste mun pa nas mun par 'gro bas bdag ni /
analyzed: tshe'i dus byas nas ngan song gsum du lhung ste mun pa nas mun par 'gro bas bdag ni /
translated: When their lives end, they fall into the three lower realms, going from darkness into darkness. I,

original: de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'i bgegs dang / nyon mongs pa mang du khyed du bsad de /
analyzed: de dag la snying brtse ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'i bgegs dang / nyon mongs pa mang du khyed du bsad de /
translated: out of compassion for them, have gone to the ocean, enduring many hardships and dangers.

original: khyed rnams bde bar bya ba'i phyir rgya mtsho nas nor bu rin po che dag blangs nas da khyed kun cis kyang mi brel te bde bar gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyed rnams bde bar bya ba'i phyir rgya mtsho nas nor bu rin po che dag blangs nas da khyed kun cis kyang mi brel te bde bar gyur gyi /
translated: For the sake of bringing you happiness, I have obtained precious jewels from the ocean. Now, you all should not be anxious at all, but be happy.

original: khyed rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la lus dang / ngag dang / yid bsdus te brtson par gyis shig ces thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas bstan cing bskul to //
analyzed: khyed rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la lus dang / ngag dang / yid bsdus te brtson par gyis shig ces thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas bstan cing bskul to //
translated: He taught them in various ways, saying, You should all unite your body, speech, and mind and strive to follow the path of the ten virtuous acts.

original: de ltar bstan cing bskul te @377a *//🔽dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la nan tan byed du bcug pas /
analyzed: de ltar bstan cing bskul te @377a *// dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la nan tan byed du bcug pas /
translated: Thus he taught and exhorted them.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi de dag tshe 'phos nas mtho ris gyi lhar skyes so //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi de dag tshe 'phos nas mtho ris gyi lhar skyes so //
translated: He made them practice the path of the ten virtuous acts, and when they died, they were reborn as gods in the higher realms.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na de'i pha bram ze n+ya gro dha ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na de'i pha bram ze n+ya gro dha ni /
translated: At that time, the father of the great giver, the brahman Nyagrodha,

original: da ltar nga'i yab zas gtsang ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar nga'i yab zas gtsang ma yin no //
translated: is now my father Shuddhodana.

original: de'i mar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mar gyur pa ni /
translated: The one who was his mother

original: da ltar nga'i yum lha mdzes yin no //
analyzed: da ltar nga'i yum lha mdzes yin no //
translated: is now my mother Maya.

original: sbyin pa chen po ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po ni /
translated: The great giver himself

original: nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: nga nyid yin no //
translated: is now I.

original: dngul gyi  mkhar na 'dug pa'i klu de ni /
analyzed: dngul gyi  mkhar na 'dug pa'i klu de ni /
translated: The naga who lived in the silver castle

original: sh'a ri'i bu yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yin no //
translated: is now Shariputra.

original: bee d'urya'i mkhar na 'dug pa'i klu de ni /
analyzed: bee d'urya'i mkhar na 'dug pa'i klu de ni /
translated: The naga who lived in the lapis lazuli castle

original: moo gal yan yin no //
analyzed: moo gal yan yin no //
translated: is now Maudgalyayana.

original: gser gyi mkhar na 'dug pa'i klu de ni /
analyzed: gser gyi mkhar na 'dug pa'i klu de ni /
translated: The naga who lived in the golden castle🔽is now Ananda.

original: kun dga' bo yin no; ;rgya mtsho'i lha de ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo yin no; ;rgya mtsho'i lha de ni /
translated: Ānanda was the ocean god.

original: ma 'gags pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yin no //
translated: Aniruddha was the nāga king.

original: kun dga' bo 'di klu'i rgyal po byed pa na yang nga la bsnyen bkur byas te dus la mkhas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di klu'i rgyal po byed pa na yang nga la bsnyen bkur byas te dus la mkhas /
translated: “Ānanda, when he was a nāga king, he served me and knew the right time.

original: da ltar gyi bar du yang dus la mkhas kyi /
analyzed: da ltar gyi bar du yang dus la mkhas kyi /
translated: Even now he knows the right time.

original: 'dod pa gsum yang yid bzhin du gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa gsum yang yid bzhin du gnang ngo //
translated: I will grant him the three wishes.”

original: zhes bka' stsal pa dang / kun dga' bo dga' mgu rangs nas pus mo'i lha ngas sa la btsugs te bdag gis nam mtsho'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bgyi'o //🔽zhes gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas 'khor mang po rnams la la ni /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa dang / kun dga' bo dga' mgu rangs nas pus mo'i lha ngas sa la btsugs te bdag gis nam mtsho'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bgyi'o // zhes gsol to // bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas 'khor mang po rnams la la ni /
translated: Ānanda was delighted and knelt down, saying, “I will serve the Tathāgata as far as the ocean.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob po //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob po //
translated: When the Bhagavān had spoken thus, many in the assembly attained the fruit of stream-entry, up to the fruit of arhatship.

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: Some

analyzed: bdag la bu ni /🔽gcig kyang med kyi /

translated: He became depressed and sat with his head in his hands.🔽At that time a god, knowing the king's thoughts, said to him in a dream,

analyzed: de'i tshe na lha zhig rgyal po'i bsam pa shes nas rmi lam du rgyal po la 'di skad ces bsgo'o; ;pho brang gi phyi rol tshal gyi nang na drang srong gnyis shig yod de /

analyzed: gcig gi lus gser gyi mdog tu 'dug gi /

analyzed: de'i gan du song la gsol ba thob cig dang / bur skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Go to him and make a request. You will have a son.🔽As soon as he said this, the king woke up. He went to look for the two rishis. He met the rishis and said,

analyzed: zhes bsgo ma thag tu gnyid log pa las sad nas drang srong gnyis gang na 'dug pa tshol du song ste drang srong de dang phrad nas bdag la rgyal po'i rigs @383b 'tshob pa med kyi /

analyzed: khyod bdag gi rigs su skyes te rigs sobs shig ces gsol ba btab nas drang srong des kyang de bzhin du bya'o // zhes smras so //

analyzed: drang srong gcig gis kyang bdag kyang khyod kyi rigs su skye bar bya'o //

analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / rgyal po rab tu dga' nas khyod kyang bdag gi rigs su skye bar shog cig ces smras so //

analyzed: bud med mkhas pas bu yod par shes nas bu phor shes te bdag la nges par bu pho yod do //

analyzed: de nas yang btsun mo gcig kyang sems can dang ldan par gyur to //

translated: His parents said, “Let the child go out to play.

analyzed: rnga brdungs / rol mo dang sil snyan dkrol te skye bo brgya stong snyed kyis bskor nas grong khyer gyi phyi rol du dong ngo //
translated: ” They had the road swept and decorated with banners and flags. They scattered flowers, burned incense, and made other preparations. They placed Sutasoma on an elephant decorated with the seven precious substances. They rang bells, beat drums, played musical instruments, and surrounded him with hundreds of thousands of people. original: yul mi thams cad lam gyi g-yas g-yon na khang bu brtsegs pa'i steng nas mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing /
analyzed: yul mi thams cad lam gyi g-yas g-yon na khang bu brtsegs pa'i steng nas mig mi 'dzum par lta zhing /
translated: All the people of the country stood on the roofs of the houses on both sides of the road, staring with unblinking eyes.

original: 'di'i byin dang gzi brjid ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byin dang gzi brjid ni /
translated: “ His good fortune and splendor

analyzed: tshangs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: are like that of Brahma.”

original: zhes bsgrags so /
analyzed: zhes bsgrags so /

analyzed: de nas song song ba las mu to bdag gcig gos hrul po gyon zhing snod chag pa thogs te cung zad bslang ngo //

original: de dag las kha cig ni /🔽'di skad du /

translated: Some of them said,🔽“We have no parents,

original: zhes zer ro //

original: de la kha cig ni /
analyzed: de la kha cig ni /
translated: Some said,

analyzed: bdag cag yun ring du nad kyis btab pas mi sos te dug go /

analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de la kha cig ni / bdag cag bag ma byas pas chom pos bcom ste ci yang mi bdog pas slong mo byed do //

analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: dge don gyis de skad ces smras pa thos nas mchi ma dku ste song ngo //

analyzed: de nas yang ya zad cig na shan pa dag cig srog chags bsad nas bags pa bshu ba dang / bsnyal gtubs bdag mthong ngo //

analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: bdag cag ni; zhing rmos te sa rlogs pa'i shul du sa bon btab na phyis mang du skyes te /

analyzed: des 'tshe zhing rgyal po'i dpya yang 'bul lo //

analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: dge don de la yang ngo mtshar du gyur nas pha zad song ba dang / rngon pa bya rgya bres pa dang / rnyi btsugs nas bya rnams bshor ba dang / sems can dag bya rgya dang / rnyis zin nas lus rdeb cing 'then kyang ma @385a *//
translated: “We set traps and snares and kill birds.”🔽“What do you do with the birds you catch?”🔽“We sell the meat to make a living.”

translated: “That is a terrible thing to do,” said the prince.🔽“We have no choice,” they replied.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: “We must do whatever we can to survive.”🔽The prince was saddened by what he heard and continued on his way. He came to a place where fishermen were spreading out their nets and catching many fish. The fish were writhing on the ground in heaps.🔽“What are you doing?” asked the prince.

translated: “We are fishermen,” they replied.🔽“We catch fish and sell them to make a living.”🔽“That is a terrible thing to do,” said the prince.🔽“We have no choice,” they replied.🔽“We must do whatever we can to survive.”

original: bdag cag kyang rgyud kyis las gzhan mi byed kyi /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang rgyud kyis las gzhan mi byed kyi /

analyzed: 'di ltar nya bshor zhing 'tsho bar byed do //

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //

analyzed: dge don gyis 'di lta bu dag mthong nas 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: Sudhana saw this and thought,

analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /

analyzed: 'di dag ni /

translated: He returned home and thought about this day and night. He was unhappy and went to his father. “Father,

analyzed: bdag la gsol pa zhig mchis kyi; gnong zhig ces smras so //
translated: I have a request. Please listen to me.”

analyzed: khyod smras pa bzhin du bya'o //🔽zhes smras so //
