analyzed: grong khyer gyi phyi rol na lam thog thag tu gang ngo //
translated: At that time, the streets of the city were filled with ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, the helpless, the sick, and so forth.

original: de dag kyang dpag tshad brgya dang / nyis brgya dang / sum brgya dang / bzhi brgya dang / lnga brgya dang / dpag tshad stong gi lam nas 'ongs kha cig ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang dpag tshad brgya dang / nyis brgya dang / sum brgya dang / bzhi brgya dang / lnga brgya dang / dpag tshad stong gi lam nas 'ongs kha cig ni /
translated: Some had come from a distance of one hundred leagues, two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, five hundred, and even one thousand leagues.

original: dpag tshad nyis stong /
analyzed: dpag tshad nyis stong /
translated: Some had come from two thousand leagues,

original: sum stong / bzhi stong /
analyzed: sum stong / bzhi stong /
translated: three thousand, four thousand,

original: lnga stong dang / dpag tshad khri'i bar nas lhags te sprin bzhin du 'dus nas thams cad la yid bzhin du sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: lnga stong dang / dpag tshad khri'i bar nas lhags te sprin bzhin du 'dus nas thams cad la yid bzhin du sbyin pa ni /
translated: five thousand, and even ten thousand leagues. They gathered like clouds. He gave them everything they desired:

original: gos 'dod pa la gos /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa la gos /
translated: to those who wanted clothes, clothes;

original: zas 'dod pa la zas rin po che gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / mu sar gal ba dang / bzhon pa dang / theg pa dang / khyogs @386a *//
analyzed: zas 'dod pa la zas rin po che gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / mu sar gal ba dang / bzhon pa dang / theg pa dang / khyogs @386a *//
translated: to those who wanted food, food; and also precious things such as gold, silver, beryl, and coral; vehicles, carriages, and palanquins;

original: dang / skyed mos tshal dang / zhing dang rkang 'gro la sogs te yid bzhin du sbyin par byas so //
analyzed: dang / skyed mos tshal dang / zhing dang rkang 'gro la sogs te yid bzhin du sbyin par byas so //
translated: He gave away parks, fields, cattle, and so on, whatever was asked for.

original: de ltar sbyin pa la zhugs te yun ring zhig lon pa dang / bang mdzod sum cha gcig zad nas mdzod srung gis rgyal po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa la zhugs te yun ring zhig lon pa dang / bang mdzod sum cha gcig zad nas mdzod srung gis rgyal po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: After a long time had passed, two-thirds of the treasury was exhausted. The treasurer said to the king,

original: sras kyis bang mdzod las sbyin pa bgyis nas sum cha ni zad pas /
analyzed: sras kyis bang mdzod las sbyin pa bgyis nas sum cha ni zad pas /
translated: “Your son has given away so much from the treasury that two-thirds of it is gone.

original: sum gnyis tsam las ma lus na /
analyzed: sum gnyis tsam las ma lus na /
translated: There are only two-thirds left.

original: phan tshun du 'drul ba'i skyes dang / tshong zong ci las bgyi dgongs shig ces smras so //
analyzed: phan tshun du 'drul ba'i skyes dang / tshong zong ci las bgyi dgongs shig ces smras so //
translated: Please think about what you will do about the goods and merchandise that are being traded back and forth.”

original: nga ni / sras 'di la byams pas ngo mi ldog gis /
analyzed: nga ni / sras 'di la byams pas ngo mi ldog gis /
translated: “I love my son,” the king said, “and I cannot turn him away.

original: bang mdzod stongs kyang bla'o; ;zhes smras so //
analyzed: bang mdzod stongs kyang bla'o; ;zhes smras so //
translated: Let the treasury be emptied.”

original: de nas yang ring zhig lon pa dang bang mdzod sum gnyis ni /
analyzed: de nas yang ring zhig lon pa dang bang mdzod sum gnyis ni /
translated: After a long time had passed, two-thirds of the treasury was exhausted.

original: zad / sum cha tsam lus pa dang / mdzod srung gis yang rgyal po la da ni /
analyzed: zad / sum cha tsam lus pa dang / mdzod srung gis yang rgyal po la da ni /
translated: There was only one-third left. The treasurer said to the king,

original: bang mdzod sum gnyis tsam ni zad /
analyzed: bang mdzod sum gnyis tsam ni zad /
translated: “Two-thirds of the treasury is gone.

original: sum cha tsam las ma lus na /
analyzed: sum cha tsam las ma lus na /
translated: When only a third remained, the king said to the treasurer, What are we to do?

original: phan tshun skyes bskur ba dang / tshong zong ci las bgyi zhes smras so //🔽rgyal pos de la bsgo ba /
analyzed: phan tshun skyes bskur ba dang / tshong zong ci las bgyi zhes smras so // rgyal pos de la bsgo ba /
translated: We must send to each other for more, and what are we to do about the merchandise?

original: nga'i sras sdug ches te ngo mi ldog pas smra mi phod kyi /
analyzed: nga'i sras sdug ches te ngo mi ldog pas smra mi phod kyi /
translated: The king said to him, My son is so dear to me that I cannot bear to refuse him.

original: khyod kyis thabs ci legs su byos la brel cing mi khom pa ltar bsnyad thogs shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis thabs ci legs su byos la brel cing mi khom pa ltar bsnyad thogs shig /
translated: You must find some way to make an excuse for not having time to come.

original: mdzod srung gis rgyal po las lung thob nas mdzod sgo bcad de don gnyer du song ngo //
analyzed: mdzod srung gis rgyal po las lung thob nas mdzod sgo bcad de don gnyer du song ngo //
translated: The treasurer, having received his orders from the king, closed the treasury door and went away.

original: de nas slong ba dag dge don gyi thad du lhags nas bar 'ga' ni /
analyzed: de nas slong ba dag dge don gyi thad du lhags nas bar 'ga' ni /
translated: Then the beggars came to Sudhana and said, Sometimes

original: mdzod srung mi rnyed de mdzod sgo mi phyed /
analyzed: mdzod srung mi rnyed de mdzod sgo mi phyed /
translated: we cannot find the treasurer and the treasury door is not opened.

original: gal te mdzod srung 'ongs na yang yid bzhin du @386b mi ster bas /
analyzed: gal te mdzod srung 'ongs na yang yid bzhin du @386b mi ster bas /
translated: Even if the treasurer comes, he does not give us what we want.

original: dge don gyis 'di snyam du bsams so //🔽'di ltar gyur pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dge don gyis 'di snyam du bsams so // 'di ltar gyur pa 'di ni /
translated: Sudhana thought, This is because🔽the treasurer cannot bear to refuse me.

original: mdzod srung gis thugs mi thub pas yab kyi man ngag 'ongs kyi /
analyzed: mdzod srung gis thugs mi thub pas yab kyi man ngag 'ongs kyi /
translated: My father's advice has come to me.

original: yong yang bus ni /
analyzed: yong yang bus ni /
translated: But I am a son,🔽and I must not do this.

original: pha'i mdzod stongs par bya ba mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: pha'i mdzod stongs par bya ba mi rigs kyi /
translated: It is not right to empty my father's treasury.

original: bdag gis da thabs ci zhig byas na rin po che yid bzhin du rnyed de /
analyzed: bdag gis da thabs ci zhig byas na rin po che yid bzhin du rnyed de /
translated: What means can I employ to obtain jewels as I wish and to benefit many people?

original: skye bo mang po la phan 'dogs par 'gyur snyam bsams nas mi dag la 'di skad ces dris so //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan 'dogs par 'gyur snyam bsams nas mi dag la 'di skad ces dris so //
translated: He asked the people,

original: 'jig rten na las ci zhig byas na nor dbyig mang du rnyed cing zad mi shes par 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / kha cig ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten na las ci zhig byas na nor dbyig mang du rnyed cing zad mi shes par 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / kha cig ni /
translated: What kind of work should one do in the world to obtain much wealth and to make it inexhaustible?🔽 Some said,

original: zhing cher rmos na nor dbyig mang por 'gyur zhes zer ro /
analyzed: zhing cher rmos na nor dbyig mang por 'gyur zhes zer ro /
translated: If you plow a large field, you will get much wealth.

original: kha cig ni /🔽rkang 'gro spel te spogs byas na nor mang du rnyed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni / rkang 'gro spel te spogs byas na nor mang du rnyed do //
translated: Some said,

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: If you increase the number of your pack animals and trade, you will obtain much wealth.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some said,

original: lam ring por tshong spogs byas na nor mang du rnyed ces zer ro /
analyzed: lam ring por tshong spogs byas na nor mang du rnyed ces zer ro /
translated: If you trade on a long journey, you will obtain much wealth.

original: kha cig ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni /
translated: Some said,

original: rgya mtshor zhugs te nor bu rin po che blangs na rin po che mang du 'gyur ro //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgya mtshor zhugs te nor bu rin po che blangs na rin po che mang du 'gyur ro //🔽zhes zer ro //
translated: If you go to sea and obtain precious jewels, you will have much wealth.

original: dge don gyis de dag gis smras pa thos nas zhing rmo ba dang / rkang 'gro spel ba dang / lam ring por tshong la 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: dge don gyis de dag gis smras pa thos nas zhing rmo ba dang / rkang 'gro spel ba dang / lam ring por tshong la 'gro ba ni /
translated: Śubhārtha heard what they said, and thought,

original: nga'i cha ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nga'i cha ma yin gyi /
translated: “It is not my place to plow fields, raise cattle, or go on long trading journeys.🔽I will go to sea.

original: rgya mtshor 'jug pa 'ba' zhig nga'i cha yin no //
analyzed: rgya mtshor 'jug pa 'ba' zhig nga'i cha yin no //
translated: That is my place.”

original: zhes smras nas rgya mtshor 'jug go snyam du bsams te pha ma la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras nas rgya mtshor 'jug go snyam du bsams te pha ma la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Thinking this, he said to his parents,

original: bdag ni / rgya mtsho nas rin po che mang du blangs te dbul phongs pa la sbyin pa yid bzhin du bgyi'o //🔽bdag rgya mtshor rin po che len du mchir gnong @387a *//
analyzed: bdag ni / rgya mtsho nas rin po che mang du blangs te dbul phongs pa la sbyin pa yid bzhin du bgyi'o // bdag rgya mtshor rin po che len du mchir gnong @387a *//
translated: “I will take many jewels from the ocean and give them to the poor as I wish.

original: zhig ces smras so //
analyzed: zhig ces smras so //
translated: Please allow me to go to the ocean to get jewels.”

original: de'i pha mas de skad ces smras pa thos nas 'khams te bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de'i pha mas de skad ces smras pa thos nas 'khams te bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: His parents were distressed to hear this and said to their son,

original: 'jig rten na dbul phongs pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dbul phongs pa dag ni /
translated: “In the world, the poor

original: blo med de; lus srog dang bsngos nas 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: blo med de; lus srog dang bsngos nas 'gro bar byed do //
translated: are foolish. They go, having given up their bodies and lives.

original: khyod cis phongs na de lta bur sems te /
analyzed: khyod cis phongs na de lta bur sems te /
translated: What do you lack that you think like this?

original: khyod sbyin pa byed 'dod na khyim na yod pa'i nor thams cad sbyin par khyos shig /
analyzed: khyod sbyin pa byed 'dod na khyim na yod pa'i nor thams cad sbyin par khyos shig /
translated: If you want to give, give all the wealth you have in your house.

original: rgya mtshor ni /
analyzed: rgya mtshor ni /
translated: It is not suitable to go to the ocean.

original: 'gror mi rung ste rgya mtsho'i nang na chu rlabs dang / dpa' klong 'khyil pa dang / chu srin dang / klu gdug pa dang / srin mo dang / ri chu'i mdog can la sogs pa shin tu yang ba'i bgegs mang du yod pas thar par dka' na /
analyzed: 'gror mi rung ste rgya mtsho'i nang na chu rlabs dang / dpa' klong 'khyil pa dang / chu srin dang / klu gdug pa dang / srin mo dang / ri chu'i mdog can la sogs pa shin tu yang ba'i bgegs mang du yod pas thar par dka' na /
translated: In the ocean there are many very dangerous obstacles such as waves, whirlpools, sea monsters, poisonous nāgas, rākṣasīs, and mountains with water-colored rocks. If it is difficult to escape,

original: khyod cis phongs te srog dang bsngo bar byed //
analyzed: khyod cis phongs te srog dang bsngo bar byed //
translated: why do you want to risk your life?

original: 'di la ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni /
translated: In this regard,

original: nyan pa med kyi /
analyzed: nyan pa med kyi /
translated: there is no one to listen.

original: ma sems par 'dug cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: ma sems par 'dug cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Do not think about it. Stay here.”

original: dge don gyis de skad ces bsgo ba thos nas bsam pa bzhin dum grub pas yi dam bcas te /
analyzed: dge don gyis de skad ces bsgo ba thos nas bsam pa bzhin dum grub pas yi dam bcas te /
translated: When Śubhārtha heard this advice, his wish was not fulfilled as he had hoped. He made a vow:

original: bsam pa 'di ma grub kyi bar du pha ma'i mdun du sa la khas bub tu nyal te mi ldang ngo snyam bsams nas yab yum gyis mkhyen par mdzod cig /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di ma grub kyi bar du pha ma'i mdun du sa la khas bub tu nyal te mi ldang ngo snyam bsams nas yab yum gyis mkhyen par mdzod cig /
translated: “Until this wish is fulfilled, I will not get up but will lie on the ground in front of my parents.”

original: bdag ni / bsam pa bzhin ma grub kyi bar du khas bub tu nyal ba 'di las mi ldang ngo //
analyzed: bdag ni / bsam pa bzhin ma grub kyi bar du khas bub tu nyal ba 'di las mi ldang ngo //
translated: I will not rise from this prone position until my wish is fulfilled.

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: Thus he spoke.🔽

original: de nas pha ma mi dga' ste gnyen bshes dang bgros nas rgya mtsho'i nang na dgegs yang ba mang du yod pa'i gtam yang byas /
analyzed: de nas pha ma mi dga' ste gnyen bshes dang bgros nas rgya mtsho'i nang na dgegs yang ba mang du yod pa'i gtam yang byas /
translated: Then his parents, unhappy, consulted with their relatives and told him the many stories of the dangers in the ocean.

original: bdag kyang @387b rmongs pas lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du lha kun la mchod de /
analyzed: bdag kyang @387b rmongs pas lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du lha kun la mchod de /
translated: “I, too, am confused. For twelve years I have made offerings to all the gods.🔽If you are my son, then let us eat a meal together.”

original: khyod lta zhig nga'i bur skyes na nged mdor bar zan zo zhig ces zhag gcig zhag gnyis nas zhag drug gi bar du tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gros btab kyang ma nyan te /
analyzed: khyod lta zhig nga'i bur skyes na nged mdor bar zan zo zhig ces zhag gcig zhag gnyis nas zhag drug gi bar du tshig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gros btab kyang ma nyan te /
translated: For one day, two days, up to six days, they tried to persuade him with various words, but he would not listen.

original: sngar ji skad smras pa las ma ldog go /
analyzed: sngar ji skad smras pa las ma ldog go /
translated: He did not turn back from what he had said before.

original: pha ma sdangs nas yang 'di skad ces bgros so //
analyzed: pha ma sdangs nas yang 'di skad ces bgros so //
translated: His parents were frightened and again consulted with each other:

original: bdag gi bu 'di thog ma nas da tsam gyi bar du bya ba bsam pa mthar ma grub kyi bar du mi gtong bas /
analyzed: bdag gi bu 'di thog ma nas da tsam gyi bar du bya ba bsam pa mthar ma grub kyi bar du mi gtong bas /
translated: “From the time of our son’s birth until now, he has not given up his wish until it was fulfilled.

original: rgya mtshor btang na gal te na phyir ldog kyang srid kyi /
analyzed: rgya mtshor btang na gal te na phyir ldog kyang srid kyi /
translated: If he is sent to sea, it is possible that he may return.

original: ma btang na zhag bdun lon nas 'phral du bye bral byed de; da ni /
analyzed: ma btang na zhag bdun lon nas 'phral du bye bral byed de; da ni /
translated: But if he is not sent, after seven days he will be gone forever.🔽So now he must be sent.

original: gtang dgos so snyam bgros nas bu'i drung du song ste lag pa nas bzung nas bu longs la zan zo zhig /
analyzed: gtang dgos so snyam bgros nas bu'i drung du song ste lag pa nas bzung nas bu longs la zan zo zhig /
translated: They went to their son and said, Son, get up and eat your food.

original: yid bzhin du 'gro bar gnang ngo //🔽zhes smras pa dang dge don yang langs te bza' ba zos /
analyzed: yid bzhin du 'gro bar gnang ngo // zhes smras pa dang dge don yang langs te bza' ba zos /
translated: We give you permission to go as you wish.

original: btung ba 'thungs so //
analyzed: btung ba 'thungs so //
translated: Sutasoma got up and ate his food.🔽Then he went outside and said to the people,

original: de nas phyi rol tu byung ste mi mang po la kho bo rgya mtshor rin po che len du 'gro'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol tu byung ste mi mang po la kho bo rgya mtshor rin po che len du 'gro'o //
translated: I am going to the ocean to get jewels.

original: khyed su 'gror dga' ba rnams kyang 'grogs te 'dong gi /
analyzed: khyed su 'gror dga' ba rnams kyang 'grogs te 'dong gi /
translated: Those of you who wish to come along, let us go together.

original: ded dpon yang kho bos bya la /
analyzed: ded dpon yang kho bos bya la /
translated: I will be the captain, he said.

original: yo byad kyang kho bos sbyar ro //🔽zhes bgrags so //
analyzed: yo byad kyang kho bos sbyar ro // zhes bgrags so //
translated: I will provide the provisions.

original: de'i tshe na yul de na tshong pa lnga brgya snyed kyis bdag cag kyang rgya mtshor rin po che len du mchi'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul de na tshong pa lnga brgya snyed kyis bdag cag kyang rgya mtshor rin po che len du mchi'o //
translated: And he proclaimed, At that time, in that country, about five hundred merchants said, 'We too will go to the ocean to get jewels.'

original: zhes thams cad 'dus nas chas so //
analyzed: zhes thams cad 'dus nas chas so //
translated: And so they all set out together.

original: de'i tshe yul de na tshong ba ded dpon rgan po zhig sngon chad kyang rgya mtshor lan du ma phyin pa zhig @388a *//🔽yod de; rgyal bu nyid de'i gan du song nas 'di skad ces smras so /
analyzed: de'i tshe yul de na tshong ba ded dpon rgan po zhig sngon chad kyang rgya mtshor lan du ma phyin pa zhig @388a *// yod de; rgyal bu nyid de'i gan du song nas 'di skad ces smras so /
translated: At that time there was in the country an old merchant captain who had already made many voyages to the great ocean.

original: kho bo rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i sa mkhan du 'gro dgos kyi /🔽khyod kyang chas shig ces bsgo ba dang / ded dpon gyis bdag ni /
analyzed: kho bo rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i sa mkhan du 'gro dgos kyi / khyod kyang chas shig ces bsgo ba dang / ded dpon gyis bdag ni /
translated: The prince went to him and said, I am going to the great ocean.🔽You must be my guide.

original: rgas 'khogs pa'i steng du mig gnyis kyis kyang mi mthong bas 'gro mi nus so //🔽zhes smras so //🔽de nas rgyal bu pha'i thang du song ste rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rgas 'khogs pa'i steng du mig gnyis kyis kyang mi mthong bas 'gro mi nus so // zhes smras so // de nas rgyal bu pha'i thang du song ste rgyal po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The captain replied, I am old and decrepit, and I cannot see with my eyes. I cannot go.🔽Then the prince went to his father and said, There is an old captain who has already made many voyages to the great ocean.

original: ded dpon rgan po zhig mchis pa sngon chad kyang rgya mtshor lan du ma zhig phyin te rgya mtsho'i rgyus mchis kyi /
analyzed: ded dpon rgan po zhig mchis pa sngon chad kyang rgya mtshor lan du ma zhig phyin te rgya mtsho'i rgyus mchis kyi /
translated: He knows the ocean well.

original: bdag rgya mtshor mchis pa'i sa mkhan du bka' stsol cig ces gsol pa dang / rgyal po nyid ded dpon long ba'i gan du song nas ded dpon long ba la 'di skad ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: bdag rgya mtshor mchis pa'i sa mkhan du bka' stsol cig ces gsol pa dang / rgyal po nyid ded dpon long ba'i gan du song nas ded dpon long ba la 'di skad ces bsgo'o //
translated: The king went himself to the blind captain, and said to him,

original: rgyal bu rgya mtshor 'gro 'dod de /
analyzed: rgyal bu rgya mtshor 'gro 'dod de /
translated: The prince is desirous of going to the sea;

original: nged kyis 'gror mi rung ba'i gros re lta zhig btab na ma nyan gyi /
analyzed: nged kyis 'gror mi rung ba'i gros re lta zhig btab na ma nyan gyi /
translated: I have tried to dissuade him, but in vain;

original: rgyal bu rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i sa mkhan du khyod song zhig ces bka' stsal pa dang / ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: rgyal bu rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i sa mkhan du khyod song zhig ces bka' stsal pa dang / ded dpon gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: you must go with him as guide.

original: bdag rgas 'khogs pa'i steng du mig gnyis kyang long mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag rgas 'khogs pa'i steng du mig gnyis kyang long mod kyi /
translated: The captain replied, I am old and blind,

original: da rgyal pos bka' stsal pa na bka' mi gcog go /
analyzed: da rgyal pos bka' stsal pa na bka' mi gcog go /
translated: but I cannot disobey the king's command.

original: zhes gsol to; ;de nas rgyal po pho brang du 'ongs nas nga'i bu dang rgya mtshor 'gro phod pa su yod ces dris pa dang / rgyal bu sdig don yang bdag phu bo'i g-yog tu mchi'o //🔽zhes gsol to //
analyzed: zhes gsol to; ;de nas rgyal po pho brang du 'ongs nas nga'i bu dang rgya mtshor 'gro phod pa su yod ces dris pa dang / rgyal bu sdig don yang bdag phu bo'i g-yog tu mchi'o //🔽zhes gsol to //
translated: Then the king returned to the palace, and asked if any one was willing to accompany his son to the sea; and the wicked prince said, I will go with my brother.

original: @388b rgyal pos bsam pa /
analyzed: @388b rgyal pos bsam pa /
translated: The king thought,

original: gzhan song ba bas nu bo song na phan snyam nas nu bo yang 'gror gnang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan song ba bas nu bo song na phan snyam nas nu bo yang 'gror gnang ngo //
translated: “If my younger brother goes instead of the others, it will be beneficial.” So he allowed the younger brother to go.

original: de nas rgyal bus gser srang sum stong zhig phyung ste srang stong ni /
analyzed: de nas rgyal bus gser srang sum stong zhig phyung ste srang stong ni /
translated: Then the prince took out three thousand ounces of gold.

original: gru'i zong du byas /
analyzed: gru'i zong du byas /
translated: One thousand ounces he used as the cost of the ship.

original: srang nyis stong ni /
